member.name: T:XmlPrime.CodeGeneration
member.summary: Specifies whether MSIL code is generated.

remarks.para: This is used to control whether an XPath expression, XQuery program or XSLT stylesheet is compiled dynamic methods.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CodeGeneration.None
member.summary: Specifies that the XPath expression, XQuery program or XSLT stylesheet are not compiled to dynamic methods. This often yields faster execution but may increase compilation time.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CodeGeneration.DynamicMethods
member.summary: Specifies that the XPath expression, XQuery program or XSLT stylesheet is compiled to dynamic methods. This often yields faster execution but may increase compilation time.

remarks.para: This is an experimental feature available only in the comercially licenced product.
Benchmarking has shown that using dynamic methods typeically offers 25% to 50% reduction in execution time, with a 25% increase in compilation time.
In some cases, a 75% to 80% reduction may be achieved.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.IResolvedDocument
member.summary: Defines the methods supported by a document that has been returned from an .

member.name: M:XmlPrime.IResolvedDocument.GetFragment(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves a fragment identifier to a node in the document.
member.param: The fragment identifier.
member.returns: A instance pointing at the node referred to by .

remarks.para: Currently fragments are supported only for the XML media types. These are text/xml, application/xml and */*+xml where * represents a series of characters. In this case only NCName fragments are resolved. If the fragment identifier is an XPointer expression or is not a valid NCName then a XTRE1160 is raised.
If the media type of this document is not known ( is ) then it is assumed to be text/xml, but if any errors would be raised then the root of the document is returned instead.

member.exception: An XTRE1160 error is raised if the media type is not supported, or if the fragment is invalid for this media type.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.IResolvedDocument.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media-type of the resolved resource.
member.value: The media-type of the resolved resource, or if it is unknown.

remarks.para: This property contains the media type with all optional parameters stripped.
The media type is used to resolve URI fragments in a document. Fragments are resolved for any media types specified as XML Media Types in RFC3023.

member.returns: A over the resource.

remarks.para: This will cause the encoding of the resource to be set, if it has not been already.
The behavior of this method is the same as the unparsed-text function.

member.exception: The encoding specified is not supported.

member.summary: Gets the sort key for the specified as a byte array under this collation.
member.param: A value.
member.exception: is .

remarks.para: Currently the sort keys returned are only used by XmlPrime to compare equality, so there is no requirement other than that they uniquely identify the string returned. member.name: T:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmReader
member.summary: Represents a reader that provides fast, noncached, forward-only access to XML data.
member.remarks: This class provides an instance of with support for the Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 (Fifth Edition) and Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.1 (Second Edition) specifications. It extends by implementing and . It also provides support for the unparsed-entity-public-id, unparsed-entity-system-id, is-id and is-idrefs accessors defined in . The reader also maintains the base URI of each node in conformance with XML Base (Second Edition), and performs ID type assignment for all xml:id attributes as required by xml:id Version 1.0. As such, the reader conforms to the external declarations profile of an XML processor.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XPathAtomicValue
member.summary: Represents an atomic value in the XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Data Model (XDM).

remarks.para: An atomic value is equivalent to a singleton sequence containing that item.

Note that the CLR types used to represent atomic values in XmlPrime do not correspond exactly to those used in the classes. For more information on the types used to represent atomic values in XmlPrime, see Mapping Atomic Types to CLR Types.

member.name: M:XmlPrime.XPathAtomicValue.EffectiveBooleanValue
member.summary: Returns the effective boolean value of this item.
member.returns: The effective boolean value of this item.
member.exception: Thrown if the current item is not a valid argument to xs:boolean.

remarks.para: The effective boolean value of an item is computed as follows:

item.description: If the item is of type xs:boolean or derived from xs:boolean, returns the .
If the item is of type xs:string, xs:anyURI, xs:untypedAtomic, or a type derived from one of these, returns if the value has zero length; otherwise it returns .
If the item is of any numeric type or derived from a numeric type, returns if the operand value is NaN or is numerically equal to zero; otherwise it returns .
In all other cases, raises an exception.

member.name: M:XmlPrime.XPathAtomicValue.EffectiveNumericValue
member.summary: Returns the effective numeric value of this item.
member.returns: The effective numeric value of this item.

remarks.para: The effective boolean value of an item is computed as follows:

item.description: If the item is of type xs:double or derived from xs:double, returns the .
If the item is of type xs:float or derived from xs:float, returns the cast to type .
If the item is of type xs:decimal or derived from xs:decimal, returns the cast to type .
If the item is of type xs:boolean or derived from xs:boolean, returns 1.0E0 if is , or 0.0E0 if is .
If the item is of type xs:string or xs:untypedAtomic, or a type derived from one of these, returns the parsed as a , or if is not a valid lexical representation of xs:double.
In all other cases, is returned.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XdmModule
member.summary: A module that can be imported in an XQuery program, XSL transformation or XPath expression.

remarks.para: Libraries can be made available to an XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation by adding them to the collection.
All functions within an are in the library's target namespace (as specified by ).

member.name: M:XmlPrime.XdmModule.NativeModule``1
member.summary: Returns a module defined by a native .NET type.
member.typeparam: The type that contains methods to expose.
member.returns: A new instance of containing functions representing methods from .
member.exception:
An is raised in the following conditions:
is a generic type.
The target URI is not a valid absolute xs:anyURI.
The target URI is .
is marked with the attribute and one of the methods marked with could not be imported, as it did not satisfy all of the conditions above.
member.remarks:
For an example of the use of this function, see Modules.
Libraries of functions can be made available to an XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation by adding them to the collection.
If is annotated with the then the target namespace can be specified by the attribute. If the attribute is not present, or the namespace is not declared, then the namespace of the function library is a uri with the scheme clitype. The path of the URI is the full CLI name of the type.
Here are some examples: TypeURI
clitype:System.Math
clitype:System.Decimal
clitype:System.Environment+SpecialFolder (note that this is an enumeration, and as such has no static methods to import, but this still serves as an example of how to reference a nested type)
must be a non-generic class, otherwise a is thrown.
Note that in order to ensure well defined behaviour, all functions used from within the XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation should be pure and deterministic (that is, they should have no side-effects and the value returned from the function must depend only on the values of its arguments). How many times each function is called, whether the function is called and the order in which functions are called is undefined and will change based on how the query is optimized.
If is annotated with the attribute, then only those methods marked with will be included. If any of these methods fail to satisfy the conditions below then an is thrown.
If is not annotated with the attribute, then only those methods satisfying the conditions below will be exported.
The method is public.
The method is not a generic method.
The exported name of the method is a valid NCName value.
The name of all the parameters are valid NCName values.
The return type is supported.
All the parameter types are supported.
None of the parameters are ref or out parameters.
None of the parameters are variable length argument lists.
If the method is overloaded, then no overload has the same number of arguments.
If a method has the same exported name and number of arguments as a method in a base class that would be exported, then the base class methods with the same name and number of arguments are excluded.
Exported method can be marked with the which allows the exported name of the method to be overridden. The parameters and return values of an exported method can be marked with the attribute which specifies the XDM type of the arguments and return types of the exported function.
More information about how native methods are bound to XQuery functions can be found on the Native modules page.

member.returns: A new instance of containing functions representing methods from the which is annotated with the specified if one exists; otherwise .

member.name: M:XmlPrime.ResolvedDocument.GetFragment(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves a fragment identifier to a node in the document.
member.param: The fragment identifier.
member.returns: A instance pointing at the node referred to by .

remarks.para: Currently fragments are supported only for the XML media types. These are text/xml, application/xml and */*+xml where * represents a series of characters. In this case only NCName fragments are resolved. If the fragment identifier is an XPointer expression or is not a valid NCName then a XTRE1160 is raised.
If the media type of this document is not known ( is ) then it is assumed to be text/xml, but if any errors would be raised then the root of the document is returned instead.

member.exception: An XTRE1160 error is raised if the media type is not supported, or if the fragment is invalid for this media type.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XdmException
member.summary: Represents errors that occurred during handling of an XQuery expression, XPath expressions, XSL transformation or serialization of an XDM instance.

remarks.para: Errors defined by the specifications:

item.description: XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Functions and Operators
XML Path Language (XPath) 2.0
XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language
XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 2.0
XSLT 2.0 and XQuery 1.0 Serialization

remarks.para: are identified by a URI.

member.seealso: XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Functions and Operators Error Codes Namespace

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foap0001
member.summary: An error is raised if fn:apply is called and the arity of the supplied function is not the same as the number of members in the supplied array.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foar0001
member.summary: This error is raised whenever an attempt is made to divide by zero.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foar0002
member.summary: This error is raised whenever numeric operations result in an overflow or underflow.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foay0001
member.summary: This error is raised when an integer used to select a member of an array is outside the range of values for that array.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foay0002
member.summary: This error is raised when the $length argument to array:subarray is negative.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foca0001
member.summary: Input value too large for decimal

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foca0002
member.summary: Invalid lexical value.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foca0003
member.summary: Input value too large for integer

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foca0005
member.summary: NaN supplied as float/double value.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foch0001
member.summary: Codepoint not valid.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foch0002
member.summary: Unsupported collation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foch0003
member.summary: Unsupported normalization form.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foch0004
member.summary: Collation does not support collation units.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodc0001
member.summary: No context document.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodc0002
member.summary: Error retrieving resource.

member.summary: Invalid argument to fn:collection().

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodc0005
member.summary: Invalid argument to fn:doc.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodc0006
member.summary: String passed to fn:parse-xml is not a well-formed XML document.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodc0007
member.summary: Base URI passed to fn:parse-xml is not a valid absolute URI.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodc0010
member.summary: , The processor does not support serialization.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodf1280
member.summary: This error is raised if the decimal format name supplied to fn:format-number is not a valid QName, or if the prefix in the QName is undeclared, or if there is no decimal format in the static context with a matching name.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodf1310
member.summary: This error is raised if the picture string supplied to fn:format-number has invalid syntax.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodt0001
member.summary: Overflow/underflow in date/time operation

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodt0002
member.summary: Overflow/underflow in duration operation

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fodt0003
member.summary: Invalid time zone value

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foer0000
member.summary: Unidentified error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fofd1340
member.summary: This error is raised if the picture string supplied to fn:format-date, fn:format-time, or fn:format-dateTime has invalid syntax.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fofd1350
member.summary: This error is raised if the picture string supplied to fn:format-date selects a component that is not present in a date, or if the picture string supplied to fn:format-time selects a component that is not present in a time.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fojs0001
member.summary: JSON syntax error. An error is raised if the string supplied as input does not conform to the JSON grammar (optionally with implementation-defined extensions).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fojs0003
member.summary: JSON duplicate keys. Raised by fn:json-doc, fn:parse-json or fn:json-to-xml if the string supplied as input contains a JSON object having duplicate keys, when the chosen policy is to reject duplicates.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fojs0004
member.summary: JSON: not schema-aware. Raised by fn:json-doc, fn:parse-json or fn:json-to-xml if the string supplied as input contains a JSON object having duplicate keys, when the chosen policy is to reject duplicates.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fojs0005
member.summary: Invalid JSON options. Raised by fn:json-doc, fn:parse-json or fn:json-to-xml if the string supplied as input contains a JSON object having duplicate keys, when the chosen policy is to reject duplicates.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fojs0006
member.summary: Invalid JSON options. Raised by fn:xml-to-json if the XML input does not conform to the rules for the XML representation of JSON.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fojs0007
member.summary: Bad JSON escape sequence. Raised by fn:xml-to-json if the XML input uses the attribute escaped="true" or escaped-key="true", and the corresponding string or key contains an invalid JSON escape sequence.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fons0004
member.summary: No namespace found for prefix.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fons0005
member.summary: Base-uri not defined in the static context.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forg0001
member.summary: Invalid value for cast/constructor.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forg0002
member.summary: Invalid argument to fn:resolve-uri().

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forg0003
member.summary: fn:zero-or-one called with a sequence containing more than one item.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forg0004
member.summary: fn:one-or-more called with a sequence containing no items.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forg0005
member.summary: fn:exactly-one called with a sequence containing zero or more than one item.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forg0006
member.summary: Invalid argument type.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forg0008
member.summary: Both arguments to fn:dateTime have a specified time zone.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forg0009
member.summary: Error in resolving a relative URI against a base URI in fn:resolve-uri.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forg0010
member.summary: Invalid date/time. Raised when the input to fn:parse-ietf-date does not match the prescribed grammar, or when it represents an invalid date/time such as 31 February.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forx0001
member.summary: Invalid regular expression. flags

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forx0002
member.summary: Invalid regular expression.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forx0003
member.summary: Regular expression matches zero-length string.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Forx0004
member.summary: Invalid replacement string.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foty0012
member.summary: Argument node does not have a typed value.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foty0013
member.summary: The argument to fn:data() contains a function item.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foty0014
member.summary: The argument to fn:string() is a function item.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foty0015
member.summary: The argument to fn:deep-equal() is a function item.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foup0001
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the first operand of fn:put is not a node of a supported kind.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foup0002
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the second operand of fn:put is not a valid lexical representation of the xs:anyURI type.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fout1170
member.summary: An error is raised if the $href argument contains a fragment identifier, or if it cannot be used to retrieve a resource containing text.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fout1190
member.summary: An error is raised if the retrieved resource contains octets that cannot be decoded into Unicode characters using the specified encoding, or if the resulting characters are not permitted XML characters. This includes the case where the processor does not support the requested encoding.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Fout1200
member.summary: An error is raised if $encoding is absent and the processor cannot infer the encoding using external information and the encoding is not UTF-8.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foqm0001
member.summary: An error is raised if, in a call to fn:load-xquery-module, the supplied module URI is zero-length.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foqm0002
member.summary: An error is raised if, in a call to fn:load-xquery-module, no module can be found with the supplied module URI.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foqm0003
member.summary: An error is raised if, in a call to fn:load-xquery-module, a static error (including a statically-detected type error) is encountered when processing the library module.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foqm0005
member.summary: An error is raised if, in a call to fn:load-xquery-module, a value is supplied for the initial context item or for an external variable, and the value does not conform to the required type declared in the dynamically loaded module.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foqm0006
member.summary: An error is raised if, in a call to fn:load-xquery-module, no XQuery processor is available supporting the requested XQuery version (or if none is available at all).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foxt0001
member.summary: An error is raised if, in a call to fn:transform, no XSLT processor suitable for evaluating a call on fn:transform is available.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foxt0002
member.summary: An error is raised if, in a call to fn:transform, the parameters supplied to fn:transform are invalid, for example if two mutually-exclusive parameters are supplied. If a suitable XSLT error code is available (for example in the case where the requested initial-template does not exist in the stylesheet), that error code should be used in preference.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foxt0003
member.summary: An error is raised if an XSLT transformation invoked using fn:transform fails with a static or dynamic error. The XSLT error code is used if available; this error code provides a fallback when no XSLT error code is returned, for example because the processor is an XSLT 1.0 processor.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foxt0004
member.summary: An error is raised if the fn:transform function is invoked when XSLT transformation (or a specific transformation option) has been disabled for security or other reasons.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foxt0005
member.summary: An error is raised if the fn:transform function uses delivery-format:saved and the output of the transformation cannot be saved at the requested location.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Foxt0006
member.summary: An error is raised if the result of the fn:transform function contains characters available only in XML 1.1 and the calling processor cannot handle such characters.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Senr0001
member.summary: It is an error if an item in S6 in sequence normalization is an attribute node or a namespace node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sepm0004
member.summary: It is an error to specify the doctype-system parameter, or to specify the standalone parameter with a value other than omit, if the instance of the data model contains text nodes or multiple element nodes as children of the root node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sepm0009
member.summary: It is an error if the omit-xml-declaration parameter has the value yes, and the standalone attribute has a value other than omit; or the version parameter has a value other than 1.0 and the doctype-system parameter is specified.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sepm0010
member.summary: It is an error if the output method is xml, the value of the undeclare-prefixes parameter is yes, and the value of the version parameter is 1.0.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sepm0016
member.summary: It is a an error if a parameter value is invalid for the defined domain.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sepm0017
member.summary: It is an error if evaluating an expression in order to extract the setting of a serialization parameter from a data model instance would yield an error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sepm0018
member.summary: It is an error if evaluating an expression in order to extract the setting of the use-character-maps serialization parameter from a data model instance would yield a sequence of length greater than one.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sepm0019
member.summary: It is an error if an instance of the data model used to specify the settings of serialization parameters specifies the value of the same parameter more than once.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0003
member.summary: It is an error if the serializer is unable to satisfy the rules for either a well-formed XML document entity or a well-formed XML external general parsed entity, or both, except for content modified by the character expansion phase of serialization.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0005
member.summary: It is an error if the serialized result would contain an NCName Names that contains a character that is not permitted by the version of Namespaces in XML specified by the version parameter.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0006
member.summary: It is an error if the serialized result would contain a character that is not permitted by the version of XML specified by the version parameter.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0008
member.summary: It is an error if a character that cannot be represented in the encoding that the serializer is using for output appears in a context where character references are not allowed (for example if the character occurs in the name of an element).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0012
member.summary: It is an error if the value of the normalization-form parameter is fully-normalized and any relevant construct of the result begins with a combining character.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0014
member.summary: It is an error to use the HTML output method when characters which are legal in XML but not in HTML, specifically the control characters #x7F-#x9F, appear in the instance of the data model.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0015
member.summary: It is an error to use the HTML output method when > appears within a processing instruction in the data model instance being serialized.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0020
member.summary: It is an error if a numeric value being serialized using the JSON output method cannot be represented in the JSON grammar (e.g. +INF, -INF, NaN).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0021
member.summary: It is an error if a sequence being serialized using the JSON output method includes items for which no rules are provided in the appropriate section of the serialization rules.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0022
member.summary: It is an error if a map being serialized using the JSON output method has two keys with the same string value, unless the allow-duplicate-names has the value yes.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sere0023
member.summary: It is an error if a sequence being serialized using the JSON output method is of length greater than one.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sesu0007
member.summary: It is an error if an output encoding other than UTF-8 or UTF-16 is requested and the serializer does not support that encoding.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sesu0011
member.summary: It is an error if the value of the normalization-form parameter specifies a normalization form that is not supported by the serializer.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Sesu0013
member.summary: It is an error if the serializer does not support the version of XML or HTML specified by the version parameter.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0001
member.summary: It is a fatal error for a fragment identifier to appear in the href attribute of an xi:include element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0002
member.summary: It is a fatal error for the value of the parse attribute of an xi:include element not to be "xml" or "text".

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0003
member.summary: It is a fatal error for the value of the accept attribute of an xi:include element to contain characters outside the range #x20 through #x7E.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0004
member.summary: It is a fatal error for the value of the accept-language attribute of an xi:include element to contain characters outside the range #x20 through #x7E.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0005
member.summary: It is a fatal error for an xi:include element to contain more than one xi:fallback element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0006
member.summary: It is a fatal error for an xi:include element any element other than xi:fallback from the XInclude namespace.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0007
member.summary: It is a fatal error when a resource error is encountered during processing of an xi:include element has no xi:fallback element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0008
member.summary: It is a fatal error for an xi:fallback element to appear in a document anywhere other than as the direct child of the xi:include (before inclusion processing on the contents of the element).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0009
member.summary: It is a fatal error for the xi:fallback element to contain any elements from the XInclude namespace other than xi:include.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0010
member.summary: It is a fatal error to include resources that contain non-well-formed XML when parse="xml".

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0011
member.summary: It is a fatal error for the inclusion target to be an attribute node or a namespace node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0012
member.summary: It is a fatal error to process another xi:include element with an include location and xpointer attribute value that have already been processed in the inclusion chain.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0013
member.summary: It is a fatal error for the byte sequence of a resource included when parse="text" to be outside the range allowed by the encoding.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0014
member.summary: It is a fatal error for a resource included when parse="text" to contain characters that are not permitted in XML documents.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0015
member.summary: It is a fatal error to attempt to replace an xi:include element appearing as the document (top-level) element in the source infoset with something other than a list of zero or more comments, zero or more processing instructions, and one element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0016
member.summary: It is a fatal error if the xpointer attribute of an xi:include element is present when parse="text".

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0017
member.summary: It is a fatal error if the xpointer attribute of an xi:include element is absent when parse="xml" and the href attribute is absent.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0018
member.summary: It is a fatal error if the href attribute of an xi:include element results in an include location which is a syntactically invalid URI.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0019
member.summary: It is a fatal error if the href attribute of an xi:include element results in an include location which is a relative URI.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xife0020
member.summary: It is a fatal error if the xpointer attribute of an xi:include element identifies no subresources.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xpdy0002
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if evaluation of an expression relies on some part of the dynamic context that has not been assigned a value.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xpdy0050
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the dynamic type of the operand of a treat expression does not match the sequence type specified by the treat expression.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xpty0004
member.summary: It is a type error if, during the static analysis phase, an expression is found to have a static type that is not appropriate for the context in which the expression occurs, or during the dynamic evaluation phase, the dynamic type of a value does not match a required type as specified by the matching rules in 2.5.4 SequenceType Matching.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xpty0018
member.summary: It is a type error if the result of the last step in a path expression contains both nodes and atomic values.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xpty0019
member.summary: It is a type error if the result of a step (other than the last step) in a path expression contains an atomic value.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xpty0020
member.summary: It is a type error if in an axis expression, the context item is not a node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xpty0117
member.summary: Attempt to cast to a namespace-sensitive type failed because the namespace bindings for the result can not be determined.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0025
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if any attribute of a constructed element does not have a name that is distinct from the names of all other attributes of the constructed element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0026
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the result of the content expression of a computed processing instruction constructor contains the string "?>".

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0027
member.summary: In a validate expression, it is a dynamic error if the root element information item in the PSVI resulting from validation does not have the expected validity property: valid if validation mode is strict, or either valid or notKnown if validation mode is lax.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0041
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the value of the name expression in a computed processing instruction constructor cannot be cast to the type xs:NCName.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0044
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the node-name property of the node constructed by a computed attribute constructor is in the namespace http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/ (corresponding to namespace prefix xmlns), or is in no namespace and has local name xmlns.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0054
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if a cycle is encountered in the definition of a module's dynamic context components, for example because of a cycle in variable declarations.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0061
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the operand of a validate expression is a document node whose children do not consist of exactly one element node and zero or more comment and processing instruction nodes, in any order.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0064
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the value of the name expression in a computed processing instruction constructor is equal to "XML" (in any combination of upper and lower case).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0072
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the result of the content expression of a computed comment constructor contains two adjacent hyphens or ends with a hyphen.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0074
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the name expression in a computed element or attribute constructor cannot be converted to an expanded QName.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0084
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the element validated by a validate statement does not have a top-level element declaration in the in-scope element declarations, if validation mode is strict.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0091
member.summary: An implementation MAY raise a dynamic error if an xml:id error, as defined in [XML Identifier], is encountered during construction of an attribute named xml:id.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0092
member.summary: An implementation MAY raise a dynamic error if a constructed attribute named xml:space has a value other than preserve or default.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0096
member.summary: A dynamic error [err:XQDY0096] is raised if the node-name of the constructed element node has any of the following properties: (a) Its namespace prefix is xmlns (b) Its namespace URI is http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/ (c) Its namespace prefix is xml and its namespace URI is not http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace (d) Its namespace prefix is other than xml and its namespace URI is http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace
member.remarks: Introduced in erratum http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=4463

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0101
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the the namespace URI in a computed namespace constructor is bound to the predefined prefix xmlns, or if a namespace URI other than http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace is bound to the prefix xml, or if the prefix xml is bound to a namespace URI other than http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0102
member.summary: In an element constructor, if two or more namespace bindings in the in-scope bindings would have the same prefix, then an error is raised if they have different URIs; if they would have the same prefix and URI, duplicate bindings are ignored.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0130
member.summary: The URIExpr of a computed namespace constructor is not a valid instance of xs:anyURI.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqdy0137
member.summary: No two keys in a map may have the same key value.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0009
member.summary: An implementation that does not support the Schema Import Feature must raise a static error if a Prolog contains a schema import.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0012
member.summary: It is a static error if the set of definitions contained in all schemas imported by a Prolog do not satisfy the conditions for schema validity specified in Sections 3 and 5 of [XML Schema] Part 1. Each definition must be valid, complete, and unique.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0013
member.summary: It is a static error if an implementation recognizes a pragma but determines that its content is invalid.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0016
member.summary: An implementation that does not support the Module Feature raises a static error if it encounters a module declaration or a module import.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0022
member.summary: It is a static error if the value of a namespace declaration attribute is not a URILiteral.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0031
member.summary: It is a static error if the version number specified in a version declaration is not supported by the implementation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0032
member.summary: A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one base URI declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0033
member.summary: It is a static error if a Prolog contains multiple declarations for the same namespace prefix.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0034
member.summary: It is a static error if multiple functions declared or imported by a module have the same number of arguments and their expanded QNames are equal (as defined by the eq operator).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0035
member.summary: It is a static error to import two schema components that both define the same name in the same symbol space and in the same scope.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0036
member.summary: It is a static error to import a module if the importing module's in-scope schema types do not include definitions for the schema type names that appear in the declarations of variables and functions (whether in an argument type or return type) that are present in the imported module and are referenced in the importing module.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0038
member.summary: It is a static error if a Prolog contains more than one default collation declaration, or the value specified by a default collation declaration is not present in statically known collations.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0039
member.summary: It is a static error for a function declaration to have more than one parameter with the same name.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0040
member.summary: It is a static error if the attributes specified by a direct element constructor do not have distinct expanded QNames.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0045
member.summary: It is a static error if the name of an annotation or the function name in a function declaration is in one of the following namespaces: http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace, http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema, http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance, http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions, http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions/math. http://www.w3.org/2011/xquery-options.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0046
member.summary: An implementation MAY raise a static error if the value of a URILiteral is of non-zero length and is not in the lexical space of xs:anyURI, or if it is a string that represents a "relative reference" as defined in [RFC3986].

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0047
member.summary: It is a static error if multiple module imports in the same Prolog specify the same target namespace.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0048
member.summary: It is a static error if a function or variable declared in a library module is not in the target namespace of the library module.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0049
member.summary: It is a static error if two or more variables declared or imported by a module have equal expanded QNames (as defined by the eq operator.)

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0052
member.summary: The type must be the name of a type defined in the in-scope schema types, and the {variety} of the type must be simple.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0054
member.summary: It is a static error if a variable depends on itself.
member.remarks: This error code was replaced by in XQuery 3.0.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0055
member.summary: It is a static error if a schema import binds a namespace prefix but does not specify a target namespace other than a zero-length string.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0057
member.summary: It is a static error if a schema import binds a namespace prefix but does not specify a target namespace other than a zero-length string.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0058
member.summary: It is a static error if multiple schema imports specify the same target namespace.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0059
member.summary: It is a static error if an implementation is unable to process a schema or module import by finding a schema or module with the specified target namespace.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0060
member.summary: It is a static error if the name of a function in a function declaration is not in a namespace (expanded QName has a null namespace URI).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0065
member.summary: A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one ordering mode declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0066
member.summary: A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one default element/type namespace declaration, or more than one default function namespace declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0067
member.summary: A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one construction declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0068
member.summary: A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one boundary-space declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0069
member.summary: A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one empty order declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0070
member.summary: A static error is raised if the predefined namespace prefix xml or xmlns is redeclared or if another namespace prefix is bound to the namespace URI associated with the prefix xml.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0071
member.summary: A static error is raised if the namespace declaration attributes of a direct element constructor do not have distinct names.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0075
member.summary: An implementation that does not support the Validation Feature must raise a static error if it encounters a validate expression.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0076
member.summary: A static error if a collation sub-clause in an order by clause of a FLWOR expression does not identify a collation that is present in statically known collations.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0079
member.summary: It is a static error if an extension expression contains neither a pragma that is recognized by the implementation nor an expression enclosed in curly braces.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0085
member.summary: Zero-length namespace declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0087
member.summary: It is a static error if the encoding specified in a Version Declaration does not conform to the definition of EncName specified in [XML 1.0].

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0088
member.summary: It is a static error if the literal that specifies the target namespace in a module import or a module declaration is of zero length.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0089
member.summary: It is a static error if a variable bound in a for clause of a FLWOR expression, and its associated positional variable, do not have distinct names (expanded QNames).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0090
member.summary: It is a static error if a character reference does not identify a valid character in the version of XML that is in use.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0093
member.summary: It is a static error to import a module M1 if there exists a sequence of modules M1 ... Mi ... M1 such that each module directly depends on the next module in the sequence (informally, if M1 depends on itself through some chain of module dependencies.)

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0094
member.summary: The name of each grouping variable must be equal (by the eq operator on expanded QNames) to the name of a variable in the input tuple stream.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0097
member.summary: It is a static error for a decimal-format to specify a value that is not valid for a given property, as described in statically known decimal formats.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0098
member.summary: It is a static error if, for any named or unnamed decimal format, the properties representing characters used in a picture string do not each have distinct values. These properties are decimal-separator-sign, grouping-separator, percent-sign, per-mille-sign, zero-digit, digit-sign, and pattern-separator-sign.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0099
member.summary: No module may contain more than one context item declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0103
member.summary: All variables in a window clause must have distinct names..

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0104
member.summary: A TypeName that is specified in a validate expression must be found in the in-scope schema definitions.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0106
member.summary: It is a static error if a function declaration contains both a %private and a %public annotation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0108
member.summary: It is a static error if an output declaration occurs in a library module.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0109
member.summary: It is a static error if the local name of an output declaration in the http://www.w3.org/2010/xslt-xquery-serialization namespace is not one of the serialization parameter names listed in C.1 Static Context Components.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0110
member.summary: It is a static error if the same serialization parameter is used more than once in an output declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0111
member.summary: It is a static error for a query prolog to contain two decimal formats with the same name, or to contain two default decimal formats.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0113
member.summary: Specifying a value for a context item declaration in a library module is a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0114
member.summary: It is a static error for a decimal format declaration to define the same property more than once.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0116
member.summary: It is a static error if a variable declaration contains both a %private and a %public annotation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0118
member.summary: In a direct element constructor, the name used in the end tag must exactly match the name used in the corresponding start tag, including its prefix or absence of a prefix.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0119
member.summary: It is a static error if the implementation is not able to process the value of an output:parameter-document declaration to produce an XDM instance.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0120
member.summary: It is a static error if a feature required by require-feature is not supported by the implementation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0122
member.summary: It is a static error if the name of a feature in require-feature or prohibit-feature is not in the lexical space of QName.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0123
member.summary: It is a static error if the name of a feature in require-feature is not recognized by the implementation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0125
member.summary: It is a static error if an inline function expression is annotated as %public or %private.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0126
member.summary: It is a static error if all-extensions appears in a require-feature option declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0127
member.summary: It is a static error if a given feature is both required and prohibited, directly or indirectly, in a module.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0128
member.summary: It is a static error if a feature name that an implementation supports appears in a prohibit-feature option declaration, and the implementation is unable to disable the feature.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0129
member.summary: An implementation that does not provide the Higher-Order Function Feature MUST raise a static error if it encounters a function test, dynamic function call, named function reference, inline function expression, or partial function application.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0131
member.summary: A feature prohibited by prohibit-feature is used in this module.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0132
member.summary: The module feature can only be required or prohibited in a main module, not in a library module.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqst0134
member.summary: XQuery 3.0 does not support the namespace axis.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqty0024
member.summary: It is a type error if the content sequence in an element constructor contains an attribute node following a node that is not an attribute node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqty0030
member.summary: It is a type error if the argument of a validate expression does not evaluate to exactly one document or element node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqty0086
member.summary: It is a type error if the typed value of a copied element or attribute node is namespace-sensitive when construction mode is preserve and copy-namespaces mode is no-preserve, or the typed value of a copied attribute node is namespace-sensitive when the parent of the copied node is not copied and construction mode is preserve.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xqty0105
member.summary: It is a type error if the content sequence in an element constructor contains a function item.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0030
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of an attribute written using curly brackets, in a position where an attribute value template is permitted, is a value that is not one of the permitted values for that attribute. If the processor is able to detect the error statically (for example, when any XPath expressions within the curly brackets can be evaluated statically), then the processor may optionally signal this as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0040
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the invocation of the stylesheet specifies a template name that does not match the expanded-QName of a named template defined in the stylesheet.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0045
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the invocation of the stylesheet specifies an initial mode (other than the default mode) that does not match the expanded-QName in the mode attribute of any template defined in the stylesheet.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0047
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the invocation of the stylesheet specifies both an initial mode and an initial template.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0050
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the stylesheet that is invoked declares a visible stylesheet parameter with required="yes" and no value for this parameter is supplied during the invocation of the stylesheet. A stylesheet parameter is visible if it is not masked by another global variable or parameter with the same name and higher import precedence.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0060
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the initial template defines a template parameter that specifies required="yes".

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0290
member.summary: Where the result of evaluating an XPath expression (or an attribute value template) is required to be a lexical QName, then unless otherwise specified it is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the defining element has no namespace node whose name matches the prefix of the lexical QName. This error may be signaled as a static error if the value of the expression can be determined statically.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0410
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the result sequence used to construct the content of an element node contains a namespace node or attribute node that is preceded in the sequence by a node that is neither a namespace node nor an attribute node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0420
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the result sequence used to construct the content of a document node contains a namespace node or attribute node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0430
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the result sequence contains two or more namespace nodes having the same name but different string values (that is, namespace nodes that map the same prefix to different namespace URIs).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0440
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the result sequence contains a namespace node with no name and the element node being constructed has a null namespace URI (that is, it is an error to define a default namespace when the element is in no namespace).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0450
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the result sequence contains a function item.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0560
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if xsl:apply-imports or xsl:next-match is evaluated when the current template rule is null.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0610
member.summary: If an optional parameter has no select attribute and has an empty sequence constructor, and if there is an as attribute, then the default value of the parameter is an empty sequence. If the empty sequence is not a valid instance of the required type defined in the as attribute, then the parameter is treated as a required parameter, which means that it is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the caller supplies no value for the parameter.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0640
member.summary: In general, a circularity in a stylesheet is a non-recoverable dynamic error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0700
member.summary: Tt is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the template that is invoked declares a template parameter with required="yes" and no value for this parameter is supplied by the calling instruction.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0820
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the name attribute [of the xsl:element instruction] is not a lexical QName.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0830
member.summary: In the case of an xsl:element instruction with no namespace attribute, it is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the name attribute is a QName whose prefix is not declared in an in-scope namespace declaration for the xsl:element instruction.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0835
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the namespace attribute [of the xsl:element instruction] is not in the lexical space of the xs:anyURI data type.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0840
member.summary: It is a static error if the select attribute of the xsl:attribute element is present unless the element has empty content.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0850
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the name attribute [of an xsl:attribute instruction] is not a lexical QName.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0855
member.summary: In the case of an xsl:attribute instruction with no namespace attribute, it is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the name attribute is the string xmlns.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0860
member.summary: In the case of an xsl:attribute instruction with no namespace attribute, it is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the name attribute is a lexical QName whose prefix is not declared in an in-scope namespace declaration for the xsl:attribute instruction.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0865
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the namespace attribute [of the xsl:attribute instruction] is not in the lexical space of the xs:anyURI data type.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0890
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the name attribute [of the xsl:processing-instruction instruction] is not both an NCName Names and a PITarget XML.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0905
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the string value of the new namespace node [created using xsl:namespace] is not valid in the lexical space of the data type xs:anyURI. [see ERR XTDE0835]

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0920
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the name attribute [of the xsl:namespace instruction] is neither a zero-length string nor an NCName Names, or if it is xmlns.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0925
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the xsl:namespace instruction generates a namespace node whose name is xml and whose string value is not http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace, or a namespace node whose string value is http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace and whose name is not xml.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0930
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if evaluating the select attribute or the contained sequence constructor of an xsl:namespace instruction results in a zero-length string.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde0980
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if any undiscarded item in the atomized sequence supplied as the value of the value attribute of xsl:number cannot be converted to an integer, or if the resulting integer is less than 0 (zero).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1030
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if, for any sort key component, the set of sort key values evaluated for all the items in the initial sequence, after any type conversion requested, contains a pair of ordinary values for which the result of the XPath lt operator is an error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1035
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the collation attribute of xsl:sort (after resolving against the base URI) is not a URI that is recognized by the implementation as referring to a collation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1061
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the current-group function is used when the current group is absent, or when it is invoked in the course of evaluating a pattern. The error may be reported statically if it can be detected statically.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1071
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the current-grouping-key function is used when the current grouping key is absent. The error may be reported statically if it can be detected statically.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1110
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the collation URI specified to xsl:for-each-group (after resolving against the base URI) is a collation that is not recognized by the implementation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1140
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the regex attribute does not conform to the required syntax for regular expressions, as specified in [Functions and Operators]. If the regular expression is known statically (for example, if the attribute does not contain any expressions enclosed in curly brackets) then the processor may signal the error as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1145
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the flags attribute [of the xsl:analyze-string instruction] has a value other than the values defined in [Functions and Operators]. If the value of the attribute is known statically (for example, if the attribute does not contain any expressions enclosed in curly brackets) then the processor may signal the error as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1150
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the regex attribute [of the xsl:analyze-string instruction] is a regular expression that matches a zero-length string: or more specifically, if the regular expression $r and flags $f are such that matches("", $r, $f) returns true. If the regular expression is known statically (for example, if the attribute does not contain any expressions enclosed in curly brackets) then the processor may signal the error as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1170
member.summary: fn:unparsed-test called with uri containing a fragment identifier, or if it cannot be used to retrieve a resource containing a text.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1190
member.summary: fn:unparsed-test called with unsupported encoding.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1200
member.summary: fn:unparsed-test called with uri which cannot be decoded.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1260
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the value is not a valid QName, or if there is no namespace declaration in scope for the prefix of the QName, or if the name obtained by expanding the QName is not the same as the expanded name of any xsl:key declaration in the stylesheet. If the processor is able to detect the error statically (for example, when the argument is supplied as a string literal), then the processor may optionally signal this as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1270
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error to call the key function with two arguments if there is no context node, or if the root of the tree containing the context node is not a document node; or to call the function with three arguments if the root of the tree containing the node supplied in the third argument is not a document node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1280
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the name specified as the $decimal-format-name argument [ to the format-number function] is not a valid QName, or if its prefix has not been declared in an in-scope namespace declaration, or if the stylesheet does not contain a declaration of a decimal-format with a matching expanded-QName. If the processor is able to detect the error statically (for example, when the argument is supplied as a string literal), then the processor may optionally signal this as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1310
member.summary: The picture string [supplied to the format-number function] must conform to the following rules. [ See full specification.] It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the picture string does not satisfy these rules.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1340
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the syntax of the picture is incorrect.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1350
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if a component specifier within the picture refers to components that are not available in the given type of $value, for example if the picture supplied to the format-time refers to the year, month, or day component.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1360
member.summary: If the current function is evaluated within an expression that is evaluated when the context item is undefined, a non-recoverable dynamic error occurs.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1370
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the unparsed-entity-uri function is called when there is no context node, or when the root of the tree containing the context node is not a document node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1380
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the unparsed-entity-public-id function is called when there is no context node, or when the root of the tree containing the context node is not a document node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1390
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the value is not a valid QName, or if there is no namespace declaration in scope for the prefix of the QName. If the processor is able to detect the error statically (for example, when the argument is supplied as a string literal), then the processor may optionally signal this as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1400
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the argument does not evaluate to a string that is a valid QName, or if there is no namespace declaration in scope for the prefix of the QName. If the processor is able to detect the error statically (for example, when the argument is supplied as a string literal), then the processor may optionally signal this as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1425
member.summary: When backwards compatible behaviour is enabled, it is a non-recoverable dynamic error to evaluate an extension function call if no implementation of the extension function is available.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1428
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the argument [passed to the type-available function] does not evaluate to a string that is a valid QName, or if there is no namespace declaration in scope for the prefix of the QName. If the processor is able to detect the error statically (for example, when the argument is supplied as a string literal), then the processor may optionally signal this as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1440
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the argument does not evaluate to a string that is a valid QName, or if there is no namespace declaration in scope for the prefix of the QName. If the processor is able to detect the error statically (for example, when the argument is supplied as a string literal), then the processor may optionally signal this as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1450
member.summary: When a processor performs fallback for an extension instruction that is not recognized, if the instruction element has one or more xsl:fallback children, then the content of each of the xsl:fallback children must be evaluated; it is a non-recoverable dynamic error if it has no xsl:fallback children.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1460
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the effective value of the format attribute is not a valid lexical QName, or if it does not match the expanded-QName of an output definition in the stylesheet. If the processor is able to detect the error statically (for example, when the format attribute contains no curly brackets), then the processor may optionally signal this as a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1480
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error to evaluate the xsl:result-document instruction in temporary output state.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1490
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error for a transformation to generate two or more final result trees with the same URI.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde1665
member.summary: A basic XSLT processor must raise a non-recoverable dynamic error if the input to the processor includes a node with a type annotation other than xs:untyped or xs:untypedAtomic, or an atomic value of a type other than those which a basic XSLT processor supports. This error will not arise if the input-type-annotations attribute is set to strip.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtde3160
member.summary: It is a non-recoverable dynamic error if the target expression is not a valid XPath 3.0 expression (that is, if a static error occurs when analyzing the string according to the rules of the XPath 3.0 specification).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtmm9000
member.summary: When a transformation is terminated by use of xsl:message terminate="yes", the effect is the same as when a non-recoverable dynamic error occurs during the transformation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtmm9001
member.summary: When the xsl:assert condition fails and assertions are set to true. The effect is the same as when anon-recoverable dynamic error occurs during the transformation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtre0540
member.summary: It is a recoverable dynamic error if the conflict resolution algorithm for template rules leaves more than one matching template rule. The optional recovery action is to select, from the matching template rules that are left, the one that occurs last in declaration order.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtre1500
member.summary: It is a recoverable dynamic error for a stylesheet to write to an external resource and read from the same resource during a single transformation, whether or not the same URI is used to access the resource in both cases. The optional recovery action is implementation-dependent: implementations are not required to detect the error condition. Note that if the error is not detected, it is undefined whether the document that is read from the resource reflects its state before or after the result tree is written.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtre1160
member.summary: When a URI reference contains a fragment identifier, it is a recoverable dynamic error if the media type is not one that is recognized by the processor, or if the fragment identifier does not conform to the rules for fragment identifiers for that media type, or if the fragment identifier selects something other than a sequence of nodes (for example, if it selects a range of characters within a text node). The optional recovery action is to ignore the fragment identifier and return the document node. The set of media types recognized by a processor is implementation-defined.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0010
member.summary: A static error is signalled if an XSLT-defined element is used in a context where it is not permitted, if a required attribute is omitted, or if the content of the element does not correspond to the content that is allowed for the element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0020
member.summary: It is a static error if an attribute (other than an attribute written using curly brackets in a position where an attribute value template is permitted) contains a value that is not one of the permitted values for that attribute.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0080
member.summary: It is a static error to use a reserved namespace in the name of a named template, a mode, an attribute set, a key, a decimal-format, a variable or parameter, a stylesheet function, a named output definition, or a character map.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0090
member.summary: It is a static error for an element from the XSLT namespace to have an attribute whose namespace is unprefixed or the XSLT namespace, other than attributes defined for the element in this document.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0110
member.summary: The value of the version attribute must be a number: specifically, it must be a a valid instance of the type xs:decimal as defined in [XML Schema Part 2].

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0120
member.summary: An xsl:stylesheet element must not have any text node children.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0125
member.summary: It is a static error if the value of an [xsl:]default-collation attribute, after resolving against the base URI, contains no URI that the implementation recognizes as a collation URI.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0130
member.summary: It is a static error if the xsl:stylesheet element has a child element whose name has a null namespace URI.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0150
member.summary: A literal result element that is used as the outermost element of a simplified stylesheet module must have an xsl:version attribute.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0165
member.summary: It is a static error if the processor is not able to retrieve the resource identified by the URI reference [ in the href attribute of xsl:include or xsl:import] , or if the resource that is retrieved does not contain a stylesheet module conforming to this specification.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0170
member.summary: An xsl:include element must be a top-level element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0180
member.summary: It is a static error if a stylesheet module directly or indirectly includes itself.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0190
member.summary: An xsl:import element must be a top-level element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0200
member.summary: The xsl:import element children must precede all other element children of an xsl:stylesheet element, including any xsl:include element children and any user-defined data elements.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0210
member.summary: It is a static error if a stylesheet module directly or indirectly imports itself.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0215
member.summary: It is a static error if an xsl:import-schema element that contains an xs:schema element has a schema-location attribute, or if it has a namespace attribute that conflicts with the target namespace of the contained schema.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0220
member.summary: It is a static error if the synthetic schema document does not satisfy the constraints described in [XML Schema Part 1] (section 5.1, Errors in Schema Construction and Structure). This includes, without loss of generality, conflicts such as multiple definitions of the same name.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0260
member.summary: Within an XSLT element that is required to be empty, any content other than comments or processing instructions, including any whitespace text node preserved using the xml:space="preserve" attribute, is a static error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0265
member.summary: It is a static error if there is a stylesheet module in the stylesheet that specifies input-type-annotations="strip" and another stylesheet module that specifies input-type-annotations="preserve".

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0280
member.summary: In the case of a prefixed QName used as the value of an attribute in the stylesheet, or appearing within an XPath expression in the stylesheet, it is a static error if the defining element has no namespace node whose name matches the prefix of the QName.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0340
member.summary: Where an attribute is defined to contain a pattern, it is a static error if the pattern does not match the production Pattern.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0350
member.summary: It is a static error if an unescaped left curly bracket appears in a fixed part of an attribute value template without a matching right curly bracket.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0370
member.summary: It is a static error if an unescaped right curly bracket occurs in a fixed part of an attribute value template.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0500
member.summary: An xsl:template element must have either a match attribute or a name attribute, or both. An xsl:template element that has no match attribute must have no mode attribute and no priority attribute.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0530
member.summary: The value of this attribute [the priority attribute of the xsl:template element] must conform to the rules for the xs:decimal type defined in [XML Schema Part 2]. Negative values are permitted..

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0550
member.summary: It is a static error if the list [of modes in the mode attribute of xsl:template] is empty, if the same token is included more than once in the list, if the list contains an invalid token, or if the token #all appears together with any other value.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0580
member.summary: It is a static error if two parameters of a template or of a stylesheet function have the same name.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0620
member.summary: It is a static error if a variable-binding element has a select attribute and has non-empty content.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0630
member.summary: It is a static error if a stylesheet contains more than one binding of a global variable with the same name and same import precedence, unless it also contains another binding with the same name and higher import precedence.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0650
member.summary: It is a static error if a stylesheet contains an xsl:call-template instruction whose name attribute does not match the name attribute of any xsl:template in the stylesheet.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0660
member.summary: It is a static error if a stylesheet contains more than one template with the same name and the same import precedence, unless it also contains a template with the same name and higher import precedence.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0670
member.summary: It is a static error if a single xsl:call-template, xsl:apply-templates, xsl:apply-imports, or xsl:next-match element contains two or more xsl:with-param elements with matching name attributes.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0680
member.summary: In the case of xsl:call-template, it is a static error to pass a non-tunnel parameter named x to a template that does not have a template parameter named x, unless backwards compatible behavior is enabled for the xsl:call-template instruction.
