member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0690
member.summary: It is a static error if a template that is invoked using xsl:call-template declares a template parameter specifying required="yes" and not specifying tunnel="yes", if no value for this parameter is supplied by the calling instruction.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0710
member.summary: It is a static error if the value of the use-attribute-sets attribute of an xsl:copy, xsl:element, or xsl:attribute-set element, or the xsl:use-attribute-sets attribute of a literal result element, is not a whitespace-separated sequence of QNames, or if it contains a QName that does not match the name attribute of any xsl:attribute-set declaration in the stylesheet.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0720
member.summary: It is a static error if an xsl:attribute-set element directly or indirectly references itself via the names contained in the use-attribute-sets attribute.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0740
member.summary: A stylesheet function must have a prefixed name, to remove any risk of a clash with a function in the default function namespace. It is a static error if the name has no prefix.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0760
member.summary: Because arguments to a stylesheet function call must all be specified, the xsl:param elements within an xsl:function element must not specify a default value: this means they must be empty, and must not have a select attribute.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0770
member.summary: It is a static error for a stylesheet to contain two or more functions with the same expanded-QName, the same arity, and the same import precedence, unless there is another function with the same expanded-QName and arity, and a higher import precedence.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0805
member.summary: It is a static error if an attribute on a literal result element is in the XSLT namespace, unless it is one of the attributes explicitly defined in this specification.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0808
member.summary: It is a static error if a namespace prefix is used within the [xsl:]exclude-result-prefixes attribute and there is no namespace binding in scope for that prefix.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0809
member.summary: It is a static error if the value #default is used within the [xsl:]exclude-result-prefixes attribute and the parent element of the [xsl:]exclude-result-prefixes attribute has no default namespace.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0810
member.summary: It is a static error if there is more than one such declaration [more than one xsl:namespace-alias declaration] with the same literal namespace URI and the same import precedence and different values for the target namespace URI, unless there is also an xsl:namespace-alias declaration with the same literal namespace URI and a higher import precedence.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0812
member.summary: It is a static error if a value other than #default is specified for either the stylesheet-prefix or the result-prefix attributes of the xsl:namespace-alias element when there is no in-scope binding for that namespace prefix.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0840
member.summary: It is a static error if the select attribute of the xsl:attribute element is present unless the element has empty content.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0870
member.summary: It is a static error if the select attribute of the xsl:value-of element is present when the content of the element is non-empty, or if the select attribute is absent when the content is empty.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0880
member.summary: It is a static error if the select attribute of the xsl:processing-instruction element is present unless the element has empty content.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0910
member.summary: It is a static error if the select attribute of the xsl:namespace element is present when the element has content other than one or more xsl:fallback instructions, or if the select attribute is absent when the element has empty content.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0940
member.summary: It is a static error if the select attribute of the xsl:comment element is present unless the element has empty content.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse0975
member.summary: It is a static error if the value attribute of xsl:number is present unless the select, level, count, and from attributes are all absent.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1015
member.summary: It is a static error if an xsl:sort element with a select attribute has non-empty content.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1017
member.summary: It is a static error if an xsl:sort element other than the first in a sequence of sibling xsl:sort elements has a stable attribute.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1040
member.summary: It is a static error if an xsl:perform-sort instruction with a select attribute has any content other than xsl:sort and xsl:fallback instructions.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1060
member.summary: It is a static error if the current-group function is used within a pattern.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1070
member.summary: It is a static error if the current-grouping-key function is used within a pattern.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1080
member.summary: These four attributes [the group-by, group-adjacent, group-starting-with, and group-ending-with attributes of xsl:for-each-group ] are mutually exclusive: it is a static error if none of these four attributes is present, or if more than one of them is present.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1090
member.summary: It is an error to specify the collation attribute if neither the group-by attribute nor group-adjacent attribute is specified.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1130
member.summary: It is a static error if the xsl:analyze-string instruction contains neither an xsl:matching-substring nor an xsl:non-matching-substring element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1205
member.summary: It is a static error if an xsl:key declaration has a use attribute and has non-empty content, or if it has empty content and no use attribute.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1210
member.summary: It is a static error if the xsl:key declaration has a collation attribute whose value (after resolving against the base URI) is not a URI recognized by the implementation as referring to a collation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1220
member.summary: It is a static error if there are several xsl:key declarations in the stylesheet with the same key name and different effective collations. Two collations are the same if their URIs are equal under the rules for comparing xs:anyURI values, or if the implementation can determine that they are different URIs referring to the same collation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1290
member.summary: It is a static error if a named or unnamed decimal format contains two conflicting values for the same attribute in different xsl:decimal-format declarations having the same import precedence, unless there is another definition of the same attribute with higher import precedence.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1295
member.summary: It is a static error if the character specified in the zero-digit attribute is not a digit or is a digit that does not have the numeric value zero.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1300
member.summary: It is a static error if, for any named or unnamed decimal format, the variables representing characters used in a picture string do not each have distinct values. These variables are decimal-separator-sign, grouping-sign, percent-sign, per-mille-sign, digit-zero-sign, digit-sign, and pattern-separator-sign.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1430
member.summary: It is a static error if there is no namespace bound to the prefix on the element bearing the [xsl:]extension-element-prefixes attribute or, when #default is specified, if there is no default namespace.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1505
member.summary: It is a static error if both the [xsl:]type and [xsl:]validation attributes are present on the xsl:element, xsl:attribute, xsl:copy, xsl:copy-of, xsl:document, or xsl:result-document instructions, or on a literal result element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1520
member.summary: It is a static error if the value of the type attribute of an xsl:element, xsl:attribute, xsl:copy, xsl:copy-of, xsl:document, or xsl:result-document instruction, or the xsl:type attribute of a literal result element, is not a valid QName, or if it uses a prefix that is not defined in an in-scope namespace declaration, or if the QName is not the name of a type definition included in the in-scope schema components for the stylesheet.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1530
member.summary: [ERR XTSE1530] It is a static error if the value of the type attribute of an xsl:attribute instruction refers to a complex type definition.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1560
member.summary: It is a static error if two xsl:output declarations within an output definition specify explicit values for the same attribute (other than cdata-section-elements and use-character-maps), with the values of the attributes being not equal, unless there is another xsl:output declaration within the same output definition that has higher import precedence and that specifies an explicit value for the same attribute.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1570
member.summary: The value [of the method attribute on xsl:output ] must (if present) be a valid QName. If the QName does not have a prefix, then it identifies a method specified in [XSLT and XQuery Serialization] and must be one of xml, html, xhtml, or text.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1580
member.summary: It is a static error if the stylesheet contains two or more character maps with the same name and the same import precedence, unless it also contains another character map with the same name and higher import precedence.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1590
member.summary: It is a static error if a name in the use-character-maps attribute of the xsl:output or xsl:character-map elements does not match the name attribute of any xsl:character-map in the stylesheet.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1600
member.summary: It is a static error if a character map references itself, directly or indirectly, via a name in the use-character-maps attribute.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1650
member.summary: A basic XSLT processor must signal a static error if the stylesheet includes an xsl:import-schema declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtse1660
member.summary: A basic XSLT processor must signal a static error if the stylesheet includes an [xsl:]type attribute, or an [xsl:]validation or default-validation attribute with a value other than strip.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0505
member.summary: It is a type error if the result of evaluating the sequence constructor cannot be converted to the required type.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0510
member.summary: It is a type error if an xsl:apply-templates instruction with no select attribute is evaluated when the context item is not a node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0520
member.summary: It is a type error if the sequence returned by the select expression [of xsl:apply-templates] contains an item that is not a node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0570
member.summary: It is a type error if the supplied value of a variable cannot be converted to the required type.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0590
member.summary: It is a type error if the conversion of the supplied value of a parameter to its required type fails.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0600
member.summary: If a default value is given explicitly, that is, if there is either a select attribute or a non-empty sequence constructor, then it is a type error if the default value cannot be converted to the required type, using the function conversion rules.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0780
member.summary: If the as attribute is specified, then the result evaluated by the sequence constructor (see 5.7 Sequence Constructors) is converted to the required type, using the function conversion rules. It is a type error if this conversion fails. If the as attribute is omitted, the calculated result is used as supplied, and no conversion takes place.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0790
member.summary: If the value of a parameter to a stylesheet function cannot be converted to the required type, a type error is signaled.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0945
member.summary: It is a type error to use the xsl:copy when the context item is not defined.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0950
member.summary: It is a type error to use the xsl:copy or xsl:copy-of instruction to copy a node that has namespace-sensitive content if the copy-namespaces attribute has the value no and its explicit or implicit validation attribute has the value preserve. It is also a type error if either of these instructions (with validation="preserve") is used to copy an attribute having namespace-sensitive content, unless the parent element is also copied. A node has namespace-sensitive content if its typed value contains an item of type xs:QName or xs:NOTATION or a type derived therefrom. The reason this is an error is because the validity of the content depends on the namespace context being preserved.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte0990
member.summary: It is a type error if the xsl:number instruction is evaluated, with no value or select attribute, when the context item is not a node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1000
member.summary: It is a type error if the result of evaluating the select attribute of the xsl:number instruction is anything other than a single node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1020
member.summary: If any sort key value, after atomization and any type conversion required by the data-type attribute, is a sequence containing more than one item, then the effect depends on whether the xsl:sort element is evaluated with backwards compatible behavior. With backwards compatible behavior, the effective sort key value is the first item in the sequence. In other cases, this is a type error.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1100
member.summary: It is a type error if the grouping key evaluated using the group-adjacent attribute is an empty sequence, or a sequence containing more than one item.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1120
member.summary: When the group-starting-with or group-ending-with attribute is used, it is a type error if the result of evaluating the select expression contains an item that is not a node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1510
member.summary: If the validation attribute of an xsl:element, xsl:attribute, xsl:copy, xsl:copy-of, or xsl:result-document instruction, or the xsl:validation attribute of a literal result element, has the effective value strict, and schema validity assessment concludes that the validity of the element or attribute is invalid or unknown, a type error occurs. As with other type errors, the error may be signaled statically if it can be detected statically.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1512
member.summary: If the validation attribute of an xsl:element, xsl:attribute, xsl:copy, xsl:copy-of, or xsl:result-document instruction, or the xsl:validation attribute of a literal result element, has the effective value strict, and there is no matching top-level declaration in the schema, then a type error occurs. As with other type errors, the error may be signaled statically if it can be detected statically.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1515
member.summary: If the validation attribute of an xsl:element, xsl:attribute, xsl:copy, xsl:copy-of, or xsl:result-document instruction, or the xsl:validation attribute of a literal result element, has the effective value lax, and schema validity assessment concludes that the element or attribute is invalid, a type error occurs. As with other type errors, the error may be signaled statically if it can be detected statically.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1535
member.summary: It is a type error if the value of the type attribute of an xsl:copy or xsl:copy-of instruction refers to a complex type definition and one or more of the nodes being copied is an attribute node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1540
member.summary: It is a type error if an [xsl:]type attribute is defined for a constructed element or attribute, and the outcome of schema validity assessment against that type is that the validity property of that element or attribute information item is other than valid.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1545
member.summary: A type error occurs if a type or validation attribute is defined (explicitly or implicitly) for an instruction that constructs a new attribute node, if the effect of this is to cause the attribute value to be validated against a type that is derived from, or constructed by list or union from, the primitive types xs:QName or xs:NOTATION.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1550
member.summary: A type error occurs [when a document node is validated] unless the children of the document node comprise exactly one element node, no text nodes, and zero or more comment and processing instruction nodes, in any order.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte1555
member.summary: It is a type error if, when validating a document node, document-level constraints are not satisfied. These constraints include identity constraints (xs:unique, xs:key, and xs:keyref) and ID/IDREF constraints.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte3180
member.summary: It is a type error if the result of evaluating the select expression of the xsl:copy element is a sequence of more than one item.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte3170
member.summary: It is a type error if the result of evaluating the namespace-context attribute of the xsl:evaluate instruction is anything other than a single node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xtte3210
member.summary: If the result of evaluating the context-item expression of an xsl:evaluate instruction is a sequence containing more than one item, then a type error is signaled.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0009
member.summary: The error code indicating a dynamic error in an replace value of expression.
member.remarks: In a replace expression where value of is not specified, it is a dynamic error if the node returned by the target expression does not have a parent.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0014
member.summary: In a transform expression, it is a dynamic error if the modify clause modifies any node that was not created by the copy clause.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0015
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if any node is the target of more than one rename expression within the same query.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0016
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if any node is the target of more than one replace expression (without value of being specified) within the same query.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0017
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if any node is the target of more than one replace value of expression within the same query.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0018
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if a function that was declared to be external but not updating returns a non-empty pending update list.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0019
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if a function that was declared to be both external and updating returns a non-empty data model instance.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0021
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the XDM instance that would result from applying all the updates in a query violates any constraint specified in [XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Data Model]. In this case, none of the updates in the query are made effective.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0023
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if an insert, replace, or rename expression affects an element node by introducing a new namespace binding that conflicts with one of its existing namespace bindings.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0024
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the effect of a set of updating expressions is to introduce conflicting namespace bindings into an element node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0027
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if the target expression of an insert, replace, or rename expression evaluates to an empty sequence.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0029
member.summary: In an insert expression where before or after is specified, it is a dynamic error if the node returned by the target expression does not have a parent.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0030
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if an insert expression specifies the insertion of an attribute node before or after a child of a document node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xudy0031
member.summary: It is a dynamic error if multiple calls to fn:put in the same snapshot specify the same URI (after resolution of relative URIs).

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xust0001
member.summary: The error code indicating an incorrectly positioned updating expression.

remarks.para: It is a static error if an updating expression is used in any position other than one of the following:

item.description: The topmost expression in the body of a query.
The modify clause of a transform expression.
The return clause of a FLWOR expression.
The return clauses of a typeswitch expression in which every return clause and contains an updating expression, an empty expression ( ), or a call to the fn:error function.
The then and else clauses of a conditional statement in which both the then and else clauses contain either an updating expression, an empty expression ( ), or a call to the fn:error function.
An operand of a comma expression in which each operand is either an updating expression, an empty expression ( ), or a call to the fn:error function.
The content of a parenthesized expression.
The body of a function declaration in which the keyword updating is specified.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xust0002
member.summary: The error code indicating an incorrectly positioned simple expression.

remarks.para: It is a static error if a simple expression that is not a vacuous expression is used in one of the following positions:

item.description: The modify clause of a transform expression.
The top-level expression in the body of a function declaration in which the keyword updating is specified.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xust0003
member.summary: The error code indicating more than one revalidation declaration.
member.remarks: It is a static error if a Prolog contains more than one revalidation declaration.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xust0026
member.summary: It is a static error if a revalidation declaration in a Prolog specifies a revalidation mode that is not supported by the current implementation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xust0028
member.summary: It is a static error if a function declaration specifies both updating and a return type.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0004
member.summary: It is a type error if the insertion sequence of an insert expression contains an attribute node following a node that is not an attribute node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0005
member.summary: The error code indicating a type checking error in an insert into, insert as first into or insert as last into expression.
member.remarks: In an insert expression where into, as first into, or as last into is specified, it is a type error if the target expression returns a non-empty result that does not consist of a single element or document node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0006
member.summary: The error code indicating a type checking error in an insert before or insert after expression.
member.remarks: In an insert expression where before or after is specified, it is a type error if the target expression returns a non-empty result that does not consist of a single element, text, comment, or processing instruction node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0007
member.summary: The error code indicating a type checking error in an delete expression.
It is a type error if the target expression of a delete expression does not return a sequence of zero or more nodes.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0008
member.summary: The error code indicating a type checking error in an replace expression.
member.remarks: In a replace expression, it is a type error if the target expression returns a non-empty result that does not consist of a single element, attribute, text, comment, or processing instruction node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0010
member.summary: In a replace expression where value of is not specified and the target is an element, text, comment, or processing instruction node, it is a type error if the replacement sequence does not consist of zero or more element, text, comment, or processing instruction nodes.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0011
member.summary: In a replace expression where value of is not specified and the target is an attribute node, it is a type error if the replacement sequence does not consist of zero or more attribute nodes.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0012
member.summary: In a rename expression, it is a type error if the target expression returns a non-empty result that does not consist of a single element, attribute, or processing instruction node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0013
member.summary: In a transform expression, it is a type error if a source expression in the copy clause does not return a single node.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XdmException.Xuty0022
member.summary: It is a type error if an insert expression specifies the insertion of an attribute node into a document node.

remarks.para: The collation resolver is used to resolve collation URIs specified in an XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation.
The property on the class specifies the to use.

member.summary: Returns a collation with the specified settings, or if no such collation could be created.
member.param: The collation settings.
member.returns: Returns a new instance, or if a collation implementation matching the specified settings could not be created.
member.remarks: By default, this method always returns . Override this method in a derrived class and consider integrating the International Components for Unicode library.

member.name: M:XmlPrime.CollationResolver.ResolveCollation(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, maps a collation URI to an instance..
member.param: The absolute URI of the collation to resolve.
member.returns: A instance implementing the collation with the supplied URI, or if a collation with this URI is not found.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.CollationResolver.CultureCollationResolver
member.summary: Gets the culture collation resolver.
member.value: A providing collations for .NET cultures.

remarks.para: This resolver maps URIs of the form http://www.xmlprime.com/collation/{lang}?case-order={case-order} to the collation corresponding to the .NET culture lang. The case-order parameter is optional, and may take the values upper-first, lower-first indicating the relative order of upper and lower case characters, or it can take the value ignore to ignore the case when comparing strings.

For example http://www.xmlprime.com/collation/en-US corresponds to the American English culture, http://www.xmlprime.com/collation/en-US?case-order=upper-first corresponds to the American English culture with upper case sorted before lower case, while http://www.xmlprime.com/collation/de-DE?case-order=ignore corresponds to the German culture, ignoring case.

summary.para: Specifies which warnings should be raised during compilation.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

remarks.para: Compiler warnings indicate constructs in XQuery programs, XPath expressions or XSL transformations which, while not erroneous, may indicate unintended behaviour or an accidental mistake.
Use the property to set the warnings that should be raised during the compilation of an XQuery program, an XPath expression or an XSL transformation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CompilationWarnings.None
member.summary: No extra compilation settings are enabled.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CompilationWarnings.DynamicErrors
member.summary: Issue a warning when dynamic errors are detected statically by the compiler.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CompilationWarnings.EmptySequence
member.summary: Issue a warning for expressions whose static type is determined to be empty-sequence().

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CompilationWarnings.UnreachableCode
member.summary: Issue a warning for expressions which can never be executed.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CompilationWarnings.UnusedVariable
member.summary: Issue a warning for variables that are declared but not used.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CompilationWarnings.PathReturnsConstructedNodes
member.summary: A path expression returns constructed nodes, and so the order is not defined.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CompilationWarnings.ScriptCompilationWarning
member.summary: A warning arising from compiling an external script in a <xmlprime:script> or <msxsl:script> element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CompilationWarnings.Other
member.summary: Issue a warning in other cases (eg. encoding declaration does not match the encoding of the query)

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CompilationWarnings.All
member.summary: Enables all compilation warnings

member.name: T:XmlPrime.DocumentSet
member.summary: Contains a stable cache of documents and collections used in an XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation.

remarks.para: The document set keeps a cache of all documents and collections available to the query, and those marked as unavailable. Whenever a document or collection is retrieved it is added to the . Should,an error occur retrieving a document or collection, the URI is marked as unavailable in the document set. This helps to enforce the stability of the fn:doc, fn:doc-available, fn:collection, fn:document, fn:unparsed-text and fn:unparsed-text-available functions, and the constraint that doc(document-uri($N)) is $N is true for any document node $N.
This defines the available documents, available collections and default collection components of the dynamic context.
The property specifies the to be used when evaluating an XQuery program, XSL transformation or XPath expression.
All methods of are thread safe can be called concurrently from multiple threads.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context (Available documents)
[XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context (Available collections)
[XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context (Default collection)

member.name: M:XmlPrime.DocumentSet.ShareDocumentSet
member.overloads: Returns a new which wraps the current document set..
member.summary: Returns a new which wraps the current document set..

remarks.para: When reading a document during evaluation of an XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation, the underlying will first be checked to see it already contains that document. If it does, it will be returned. Otherwise, the document will be read and placed in the . Any document created during evaluation of the XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation will reside in the .
Using a private name table results in any names that are not in the static name table to be added to a separate private name table.
If a is supplied, then it will be wrapped in a using the private name table.
This is euivalent to calling with this instance's .

member.name: T:XmlPrime.ICollectionTypeResolver
member.summary: An interface used to resolve the types of external collections.

remarks.para: The interface is used to resolve the types of calls to the fn:collection function when its argument can be statically determined.
The is specified using the property.
The collection type resolver represents the statically known collections and statically known default collection type components of the static context.
If a collection returned from the at runtime does not match the type specified by the then an err:XPTY0004 error is raised.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.1 Static Context (Statically known collections)
[XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.1 Static Context (Statically known default collection type)

member.name: T:XmlPrime.ResolvedResource
member.summary: A resource that has been returned from an .

remarks.para: The encoding used to read a resource as unparsed text is determined as follows:

item.description: The encoding specified by the is used if it is not .
If the media type is an XML media type then the encoding is recognized as by the XML specification.
If an encoding was passed to the unparsed-text function, then this encoding is used.
If a byte order mark is present, then either UTF-32, UTF-16 or UTF-8 is assumed based on the byte order mark
If none of the above cases apply, then UTF-8 is assumed.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.StaticContextSettings.DefaultCollation
member.summary: Gets or sets the default collation URI.
member.value: An instance specifying default collation URI.

remarks.para: The default collation is the collation that is used by functions and operators that require a collation if no other collation is specified.
A collation is a specification of the manner in which strings and URIs are compared and, by extension, ordered.
By default the value of this property is the default collation is the codepoint collation (http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions/collation/codepoint).
This can be overridden with a declare default collation declaration in a query.

member.exception: was set to .
member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.1 Static Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.StaticContextSettings.DefaultElementNamespace
member.summary: Gets or sets the default namespace for element and type names.
member.value: A representing the default namespace for elements and types.
member.exception: was set to
Raised if was set to http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace.

remarks.para: Setting this property is equivalent to calling DeclareNamespace(string.Empty, value).
Unless explicitly set, the default element namespace is the namespace bound to the empty prefix by the specified by the property.
This is a namespace URI or . The namespace URI, if present, is used for any unprefixed qualified names appearing in a position where an element or type name is expected.
This can be overridden with a declare default element namespace declaration in the query.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.1 Static Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.StaticContextSettings.Libraries
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of additional libraries available to the query.
member.value: A containing libraries that are available to the query.

remarks.para: By default this is an empty collection. The default function libraries are added to the collection when the query or expression is compiled
In order to use a library it must be imported, either by using an import module statement in the query, or by using the method.

If an import module declaration in an XQuery program references a namespace which already has corresponding modules in the library set, then these modules are used and the location hints are ignored. Otherwise the location hints are resolved, and the resulting modules are added to the library set.

After compilation the library set also contains all modules that have been imported by the query (either by the main module or by another library module that has been imported). Sharing the library set amongst multiple queries will avoid additional libraries from being recompiled.

member.exception: An attempt is made to set this property to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.StaticContextSettings.Namespaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the statically known namespaces.
member.value: An containing the statically known namespaces.

remarks.para: The namespace bound to is interpreted as the default element namespace.
In XQuery this property defaults to fn, xml, xs, xsi and local. In XPath and XSL the default value just contains the xml namespace.
The initial in scope namespaces are made accessible to all modules that are compiled during compilation.
These namespace declarations can be overridden in XQuery with declare namespace declarations.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.1 Static Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.StaticContextSettings.CollationResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolver for collation URIs .
member.value: The collation resolver.

remarks.para: This defines the collations that are available for use in processing queries and expressions.
A collation is a specification of the manner in which strings and URIs are compared and, by extension, ordered.
The resolver is used for all collations other than the codepoint collation (http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions/collation/codepoint).
If this is set to then the codepoint collation is the only collation available to the query.
By default the is used.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.1 Static Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.StaticContextSettings.Schemas
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of schemas used for type checking and schema validation in the query.
member.value: The containing the schemas used for type checking and schema validation.
member.exception: was set to .

remarks.para: If an import schema declaration references a namespace that is already defined in this schema set, then no additional schemas are imported.
Any schemas imported by a query will be added to this . The resolver specified by the property is used to resolve schema location hints in import schema declarations.
Documents passed into the query can be validated against this schema set in order to take full advantage of their type information.

If is not set to then the schemas must not be modified after the query has compiled. If a module is compiled independently then this schema set must contain all the schemas that are used anywhere in the query. This is because during compilation the static typing rules rely on knowing about any type that extends any other type. If the schemas change after compilation then the static typing judgements become unsound, and the query will have an undefined result.
If is set to then XmlPrime makes no assumptions about external schemas, and so it is fine for other schema types to be introduced before the query is run.
By default this is a new instance.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.Severity
member.summary: Specifies the severity of a compilation error event.

remarks.para: The enumeration is used by to describe the severity of an event which occurred during compilation. The compiler is able to attempt recovery from warnings, while errors are considered fatal.
Whilst a fatal error is unrecoverable (the query cannot be compiled), if the error is ignored then processing can continue to allow more than one fatal error to be reported.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.Severity.Warning
member.summary: The error is recoverable.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.Severity.Error
member.summary: The error is unrecoverable.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.SharedDocumentSet
member.summary: A document set wrapping a static document set.

remarks.para: The class wraps a static . Any documents and collections in the static document set are exposed through the ; but any documents added (or marked as unavailable) do not affect the underlying .

This allows a set of static documents and collections to be shared between XQuery programs, XSL transformations and XPath expressions, whilst documents loaded (or failed to load) will not be cached in the (static) document set.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XdmTypeAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to specify the XDM type of an argument or return value of a function exported in an XDM module.

remarks.para: This attribute is ignored unless the containing method is marked with the , and the containing object is marked with .

The type specified by this attribute must be a subtype of the primitive base type of the XDM type represented by the CLR type of the argument or return value of the function annotated with this annotation. For example if a function has an argument with CLR type then its XDM type is xs:int, whose primitive base type is xs:integer. This means that the argument can be annotated with any subtype of xs:integer.
If an argument or return value has a CLR type that is a subtype of (for example ) then the type that can be specified by this attribute must be representable by the argument.

If at runtime a value passed to an argument cannot be converted from the declared type to the CLR type then an ANDY1000 error is raised at runtime. Similarly if a value returned from a function cannot be converted to its declared type, or if a value returned is of a type annotated with XDM type information (for example ) and is not a subtype of the functions declared type then an ANDY1000 error is raised at runtime.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XIncludeSettings
member.summary: Represents the user-controllable settings of XInclude processing.

remarks.para: For security reasons, the loading of external resources is disabled. This means that only intra-document xi:include references can be processed.
To enable the processing of external resources, set the property.

member.name: M:XmlPrime.XIncludeSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.exception: The licence for XmlPrime was invalid

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XIncludeSettings.DocumentSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache of documents and collections.
member.value: The instance containing the cache of documents and collections.

remarks.para: The document set keeps a thread-safe cache of all documents and collections available to the query, and those marked as unavailable.

The fn:doc, fn:doc-available, fn:collection, fn:document, fn:unparsed-text and fn:unparsed-text-available functions all retrieve documents and collections through the document set. This enforces stability of these function and the constraint that doc(document-uri($N)) is $N is true for any document node $N.
In order to prevent documents from being loaded every time the XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation is run, the document set can be shared between queries.
The document set can be pre-populated with documents and collections.
If this property is set to then the loading of external resources by functions such as fn:doc and fn:collection is prohibited.
By default, this property is set to

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to perform base URI (xml:base) fixup.
member.value: if base URI fixup will be performed; otherwise, .

remarks.para: By default, the value of this property is .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XIncludeSettings.FixupXmlLang
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to perform language (xml:lang) fixup.
member.value: if language fixup will be performed; otherwise, .

remarks.para: By default, the value of this property is .

member.summary: Resolves a URI to a document.

The name table to use to load the document.

The document URI of the returned document must either be or the empty string.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XmlNamespaces
member.summary: XML namespaces with special significance to XmlPrime.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XmlNamespaces.LocalFunctionsNamespace
member.summary: The XQuery local functions namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.w3.org/2005/xquery-local-functions.

remarks.para: In XQuery, the prefix local is bound to this namespace by default.
The local functions namespace is intended for use by functions in an XQuery main module, to avoid having to create a new namespace in which to declare them.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.15 Function Declaration

This namespace is the namespace for all elements in Mathematical Markup Language (MathML) Version 3.0.
Mathematical Markup Language (MathML) Version 3.0 .

member.summary: The XSLT and XQuery Serialization 3.0 namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.w3.org/2010/xslt-xquery-serialization/.
member.remarks: The serialization namespace can be used along with the declare option syntax to set serialization parameters from within a query.
member.seealso: [XSLT and XQuery Serialization 3.0] 3.1 Setting Serialization Parameters by Means of a Data Model Instance

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XmlNamespaces.SerializationNamespace
member.summary: The XmlPrime serialization options namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.xmlprime.com/serialization.
member.remarks: The serialization namespace can be used along with the declare option syntax to set serialization parameters from within a query. This is also the namespace of the implementation specific XmlPrime output methods and serialization parameters. Note that this namespace is specific to XmlPrime.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XmlNamespaces.XPathFunctionsNamespace
member.summary: The XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 functions namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions.

remarks.para: This namespace is the namespace of the built in functions in XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Functions and Operators, as well as the additional stylesheet functions defined in XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 2.0.
This is the default function namespace in XQuery, XPath 2.0 and XSLT 2.0. The fn prefix is conventionally bound to this namespace. In XQuery the fn prefix is bound to this prefix by default.

member.seealso: XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Functions and Operators

member.summary: The XML Inclusion (XInclude) namespace.

remarks.para: This namespace is the namespace for all elements in XML Inclusions (XInclude) Version 1.0.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XmlNamespaces.XmlNamespace
member.summary: The XML namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace

remarks.para: The prefix xml is always bound to this namespace, and no other prefix can be bound to this namespace.

This namespace is used for the special attributes xml:lang, xml:space (as defined in Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 (Fifth Edition)), xml:base (as defined in Xml Base (Second Edition)) and xml:id (as defined in xml:id Version 1.0).

member.seealso: [Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 (Fifth Edition)] 2.10 White Space Handling

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XmlNamespaces.XmlNamespacesNamespace
member.summary: The XML Namespaces namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/.

remarks.para: The prefix xmlns is always bound to this namespace, and no other prefix can be bound to this namespace.
It is impossible to construct an element or attribute in this namespace, although this is the namespace of namespace nodes in a DOM representation.

member.seealso: A Namespace Name for xmlns Attributes

member.summary: The XmlPrime error namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.xmlprime.com/errors.

member.summary: The XmlPrime namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.xmlprime.com/.
member.remarks: This namespace is used for XmlPrime extension functions, pragmas and instructions. Note that this namespace is specific to XmlPrime.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XmlNamespaces.XmlSchemaNamespace
member.summary: The XML Schema namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema

remarks.para: This is the namespace used by XML Schema, and for all the built in types defined by the XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Data Model.
The xs prefix is conventionally bound to this namespace. In XQuery, the xs prefix is bound to this namespace by default.

member.seealso: XML Schema Part 1: Structures Second Edition
XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition
[XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Data Model] 2.6.2 Predefined Types

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XmlNamespaces.XsiNamespace
member.summary: The XML Schema Instance namespace.
member.value: The value http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance

remarks.para: This namespace is defined by XML Schema Part 1: Structures Second Edition and is used for the special attributes xsi:type, xsi:nil, xsi:schemaLocation and xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation.
The xsi prefix is conventionally bound to this namespace. In XQuery, the xsi prefix is bound to this namespace by default.

member.seealso: [Xml Schema Part 1: Structures Second Edition] 2.6 Schema-Related Markup in Documents Being Validated

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XdmFunctionAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to export a function in an XDM module.

remarks.para: The property can be used to specify the name of the exported function in XQuery.
This attribute is ignored unless the containing object is marked with .
If the function does not satisfy the conditions specified for then a will be thrown when is called for the containing type.
The can be used to specify the XDM types of the arguments and the return type of the exported function.

member.name: M:XmlPrime.XdmFunctionAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: The local name of the exported function.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XdmFunctionAttribute.LocalName
member.summary: The local name of the exported function.
member.value: The local name of the exported function.

remarks.para: The namespace of the function is specified by the attribute on the containing type.
If this property is set to then the name of the method is used.

If this property is set to a value that is not a valid xs:NCName, or this property is set to , and the name of the exported method is not a valid xs:NCName then a will be thrown when an attempt is made to load the containing module.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XdmModuleAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a class implements an XDM module.

remarks.para: An XDM module exports a number of functions that can be called from an XPath expression, XQuery program, or XSL transformation. In order to use such a module, call the method to obtain an object which can be added to the property.
The property can be set to define the target namespace of the module.
Only public static functions with the attribute are exported.

member.name: M:XmlPrime.XdmModuleAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: All exported functions in the module are in the target namespace.
The target namespace will be set to a URI with scheme clitype and with the path equal to the full CLR name of the type, URL encoded if necessary.

member.name: M:XmlPrime.XdmModuleAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The target namespace of the module.

remarks.para: All exported functions in the module are in the target namespace.
If is set to then the namespace is set to a URI with scheme clitype and with the path equal to the full CLR name of the type, URL encoded if necessary.
If is set to a value that is not a valid absolute xs:anyURI then a will be thrown when an attempt is made to load the module.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XdmModuleAttribute.TargetNamespace
member.summary: Gets or sets the target namespace of the module.
member.value: The target namespace of the module, or to use the default.
member.summary: The target namespace of the exported module.
member.value: The target namespace of the module.

If this property is set to a value that is not a valid absolute xs:anyURI then a will be thrown when an attempt is made to load the module.

This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

Note that the Static Typing Feature may be enabled by setting the properties to or .

member.name: T:XmlPrime.OptimizationLevel
member.summary: Specifies the level of optimization to perform during query compilation.

remarks.para: The optimization level controls the kinds of optimizations performed which will be performed during compilation of an XQuery program, and XPath expression or an XSL transformation.

Higher levels of optimization may increase the time taken to compile a query, but typically improve the execution speed. This is particularly noticeable when the query performs a significant amount of computation or is dealing with large input data.
Use the property to set the level of optimization that will be performed during the compilation of an XQuery program, an XPath expression or an XSL transformation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.OptimizationLevel.None
member.summary: No query optimization is performed.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.OptimizationLevel.Local
member.summary: Only localized query optimizations are performed. In particular, common subexpression elimination is not applied.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.OptimizationLevel.Global
member.summary: Localized and global query optimizations are performed, including those that significantly change the structure of the query.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.OptimizationLevel.Join
member.summary: Join optimizations are performed, in addition to local and global optimizations.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.OptimizationLevel.Specialization
member.summary: Function speciailzation is performed, in addition to join, local and global optimizations.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.ConstructionMode
member.summary: Specifies the construction mode of an XQuery module.

remarks.para: The construction mode governs the behaviour of element and document node constructors.
Use the property to set the default construction mode.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.6 Construction Declaration

member.name: F:XmlPrime.ConstructionMode.Preserve
member.summary: Indicates that the type of a constructed element node is xs:anyType, and all attribute and element nodes copied during node construction retain their original types.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.ConstructionMode.Strip
member.summary: Indicates that the type of a constructed element node is xs:untyped; all element nodes copied during node construction receive the type xs:untyped, and all attribute nodes copied during node construction receive the type xs:untypedAtomic.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.CopyNamespacesMode
member.summary: Specifies the copy-namespaces mode of an XQuery module.

remarks.para: The copy-namespaces mode controls the namespace bindings that are assigned when an existing element node is copied by an element constructor or document constructor.
Use the property to set the default copy-namespaces mode.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.9 Copy-Namespaces Declaration

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CopyNamespacesMode.None
member.summary: This is equivalent to no-preserve, no-inherit. The in-scope namespaces of the copied element are only those used in the name of the element and its attributes.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CopyNamespacesMode.Preserve
member.summary: This is equivalent to preserve, no-inherit. The in-scope namespaces of the copied element are the in-scope namespaces of the original element.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CopyNamespacesMode.Inherit
member.summary: This is equivalent to no-preserve, inherit. The in-scope namespaces of the copied element are the in-scope namespaces of the constructed node, along with the namespaces used in the name of the element and its attributes.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.CopyNamespacesMode.PreserveInherit
member.summary: The in-scope namespaces of the copied element are all the in-scope namespaces of the constructed node, augmented and overridden by all in-scope namespaces of the original element.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.TypeCheckingMode
member.summary: Specifies the type checking mode.

remarks.para: The enumeration is used by the and properties to set the type checking mode used during during the compilation of an XQuery program or XPath expression.

During compilation, type checking is always performed. The type checking mode affects the behaviour of the compiler when the static type of an argument to an expression does not match its expected type.
Use the and properties to set the type checking mode used during the compilation of an XQuery program, an XPath expression or an XSL transformation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.TypeCheckingMode.Optimistic
member.summary: Optimistic type checking is performed. Errors are only reported in the case where the static type of an argument to an expression can never match its expected type. In all other cases run-time type checks are introduced by the compiler.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.TypeCheckingMode.Static
member.summary: Static type checking using rules defined in XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Formal Semantics augmented with many implementation-specific static typing rules. No type checking is performed at runtime.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.TypeCheckingMode.Pedantic
member.summary: Static type checking using only those rules defined in XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Formal Semantics. No type checking is performed at run time.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.UriType
member.summary: Enumerates the specifications to which a URI may comply.

remarks.para: All URIs conforming to RFC3986 also conform to RGC3987 and the LEIRI specifiation.
All IRIs conforming to the LEIRI specifiation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.UriType.LeIri
member.summary: The URI conforms to Legacy extended IRIs for XML resource identification.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.UriType.Iri
member.summary: The URI conforms to RFC3987.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.UriType.Uri
member.summary: The URI conforms to RFC3986.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.AnyUri
member.summary: Represents a Uniform Resource Locator. The corresponding XML Schema type is xs:anyURI.

remarks.para: represents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), as specified in RFC3986, an Internationzied Resource Identifier (IRI), as specified in RFC3987, or a Legacy extended IRI, as specified in Legacy extended IRIs for XML resource identification. .
can represent relative URIs as well as absolute URIs.
URIs in the file: scheme with no host also accept '\' characters as path separators. This is a deviation from RFC3986, but is an often used convention.

member.seealso: [XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition] 3.2.17 anyURI
RFC3986 Uniform Resource Identifier (URI): Generic Syntax
Legacy extended IRIs for XML resource identification

member.summary: Gets the specified components of the current instance, using the specified escaping.
member.param: A bitwise combination of the values that specifies which parts of the current instance to return.
One of the values that controls how special characters are escaped.
member.returns: A value that contains the components.
member.exception: is not a combination of valid values or is not one of the values. The value will not necessarily return an absolute URI, but will contain all the components that are present in the current instance.

remarks.para: Unlike , relative URIs can be used with this method. In this case only the components that are present in the URI are returned. The and are ignored.
The components returned are normalized as follows:

item.description: Case normalization of URI scheme, and percent-encoded values.
Omission of default ports for some schemes (eg. port 21 for the ftp: scheme).
Resolution of dot-segments (.. and . path segments).
Normalization of '/' and '\' characters in file: paths residing on localhost.

remarks.para: Other than the set of characters that are escaped, this method behaves like the method with the

member.name: M:XmlPrime.AnyUri.Normalize
member.summary: Returns a normalized string representation of the current instance.
member.returns: A normalized string representation of the current instance.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to calling the method with the values and .
This method can be used to compare URIs. Normalizing two URIs before comparing them ensures that a larger range of URIs that correspond to the same resource are considered equal.
The following techniques are used to normalize URIs:

item.description: Case normalization of URI scheme, and percent-encoded values.
Omission of default ports for some schemes (eg. port 21 for the ftp: scheme). The value can be used to include the port if it is the default value.
Resolution of dot-segments (.. and . path segments).
Normalization of '/' and '\' characters in file: paths residing on localhost.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DateWithZone.WeekInMonth
member.summary: Gets the week in the month component of this .
member.value: A representing the year component of this .
member.remarks: ISO 8601 does not define a numbering for weeks within a month. When the w component is used, the convention to be adopted is that each Monday-to-Sunday week is considered to fall within a particular month if its Thursday occurs in that month; the weeks that fall in a particular month under this definition are numbered starting from 1. Thus, for example, 29 January 2013 falls in week 5 because the Thursday of the week (31 January 2013) is the fifth Thursday in January, and 1 February 2013 is also in week 5 for the same reason.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DateTimeWithZone.WeekInMonth
member.summary: Gets the week in the month component of this .
member.value: A representing the year component of this .
member.remarks: ISO 8601 does not define a numbering for weeks within a month. When the w component is used, the convention to be adopted is that each Monday-to-Sunday week is considered to fall within a particular month if its Thursday occurs in that month; the weeks that fall in a particular month under this definition are numbered starting from 1. Thus, for example, 29 January 2013 falls in week 5 because the Thursday of the week (31 January 2013) is the fifth Thursday in January, and 1 February 2013 is also in week 5 for the same reason.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.DayTimeDuration
member.summary: Represents a duration of time that is expressed by the Gregorian day, hour, minute and second components. The corresponding XML Schema type is xs:dayTimeDuration.

remarks.para: A is a duration of time that is expressed by the Gregorian days, hours, minutes and seconds components. It can be used to represent a period of months, regardless of the number of days in a month. To say, for example, that a journey took 2 days and 14 hours.
Unlike values, values can be totally ordered.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Functions and Operators] 10.3.2 xs:dayTimeDuration

member.name: T:XmlPrime.GDay
member.summary: Represents a Gregorian day. The corresponding XML Schema type is xs:gDay.

remarks.para: A is a Gregorian day that recurs, specifically a day of the month such as the 5th of the month. It can be used to represent a specific day of the month. To say, for example, that I get paid on the 15th of each month.

member.seealso: [XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition] 3.2.13 gDay

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.BoundarySpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the boundary space policy.
member.value: One of the values.

remarks.para: The boundary space policy controls the processing of boundary whitespace by direct element constructors, as described in 3.7.1.4 Boundary Whitespace.
This setting can be overridden with a declare boundary-space declaration in the query.
The default boundary space policy is .

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.3 Boundary-space Declaration

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.ConstructionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the construction mode.
member.value: One of the values.

remarks.para: The construction mode governs the behaviour of element and document node constructors.
This setting can be overridden with a declare construction declaration in the query.
The default construction mode is .

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.6 Construction Declaration

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.CopyNamespacesMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the copy-namespaces mode.
member.value: One of the values.

remarks.para: The copy-namespaces mode controls the namespace bindings that are assigned when an existing element node is copied by an element constructor, as described in 3.7.1 Direct Element Constructors.
This can be overridden with a declare copy-namespaces declaration in the query.
The default copy-namespaces mode is .

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.9 Copy-Namespaces Declaration

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.DefaultEmptyOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the default empty sequence order.
member.value: One of the values.

remarks.para: The default empty order controls the default processing of empty sequences and NaN values as ordering keys in an order by clause in a FLWOR expression.
This setting can be overridden with a declare default order empty declaration in the query.
By default, the empty order policy is .

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.8 Empty Order Declaration

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.EnableScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whetherr to enable support for .NET script modules.
member.value: to support .NET script modules in XQuery programs; otherwise, .

remarks.para: The default value is .
When enabled, a query may import a c# source file using the syntax:
remarks.code: import module namespace ext = "http://www.example.org/xpath-functions" at "script.cs"; ext:nativeFunction(1, "value")
remarks.para: XQuery scripting should be enabled only if you require script support and you are working in a fully trusted environment.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.EnabledFeatures
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which optional features are enabled.
member.value: An value indicating which optional features are enabled.

remarks.para: Disabling a feature causes an error to be raised during compilation of a query if the feature is used in the query.
By default all optional features are enabled.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 5.2 Optional Features

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.ModuleLocationHints
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of location hints that are used in import module declarations.
member.value: A instance containing location hints that are used for module imports.
member.remarks: When an import module declaration is processed, the location hints for the target namespace in this are added to the set specified by the declaration.
member.exception: is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.ModuleResolver
member.summary: Sets the instance to be used during module import.

remarks.para: This resolver is used to resolve module location hints specified in import module declarations.
If this is set to then no external modules can be imported.
By default this property is set to .

member.value: An instance to be used during module import.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.OrderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the ordering mode.
member.value: One of the values.

remarks.para: The ordering mode controls the ordering of the result sequence returned by certain path expressions, union, intersect, and except expressions, and FLWOR expressions that have no order by clause.
The setting can be overridden with a declare ordering declaration in the query, and can be overridden locally with the fn:ordered and fn:unordered functions.
Currently, the ordering mode is ignored by XmlPrime, and all affected expressions are evaluated with their results in document order.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.7 Ordering Mode Declaration

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.SchemaLocationHints
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of location hints that are used in import schema declarations.
member.value: A instance containing location hints that are used for schema imports.
member.remarks: When an import schema declaration is processed, the location hints for the target namespace in this are added to the set specified by the declaration.
member.exception: is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.SerializationSettings
member.summary: Gets the serialization settings.
member.value: An instance specifying serialization settings.
member.remarks: These can be overridden with set option declarations in the query. The post-compilation serialization settings can be inspected using the property of an instance.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.TypeCheckingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the type checking mode to be used during compilation.
member.value: A member of the enumeration.
member.remarks: By default this is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XQuerySettings.XQueryVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of XQuery to which the processor should adhere.
member.value: An value indicating to which version of the specification the processor should adhere.
member.exception: Raised if the specified version is not supported.

remarks.para: The default value of this property is the latest version of XQuery which is fully supported. Currently this is .
When set to , if the processor encounters an XQuery module with a version declaration of "3.0", an error will be raised (err:XQST0031].

When set to , if the processor encounters an XQuery module with a version declaration of "1.0", the module will be processed using the the XQuery 1.0 specification. However, the default in-scope functions will be those specified in XPath and XQuery Functions and Operators 3.0.
Settings this value determines the set of available functions for use within XQuery expressions and determines the version of XQuery to use when parsing.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XQueryVersion
member.summary: An enumeration specifying the version of the XQuery specification that should be used.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryVersion.XQuery10
member.summary: XQuery 1.0.

remarks.para: Prior to XmlPrime version 3.0, this was the default version.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryVersion.XQuery30
member.summary: XQuery 3.0.

remarks.para: As of XmlPrime version 3.0, this is the default version.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryVersion.XQuery31
member.summary: XQuery 3.1. This is not supported in XmlPrime 3.x.

summary.para: Specifies optional XSLT features which may be switched off.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

remarks.para: Use the property to enable or disable optional XSLT features. Disabling a feature causes an error to be raised during compilation of a transformation if the feature is used in that transformation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.None
member.summary: Minimal conformance. No optional features are enabled.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.TypedDataFeature
member.summary: The Typed Data Feature permits a data model instance to contain element nodes types other than xs:untyped and attributes node types other than xs:untypedAtomic.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.SchemaImportFeature
member.summary: The Schema Import Feature permits the query Prolog to contain a schema import.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.SchemaValidationFeature
member.summary: The Schema Validation Feature permits a query to contain a validate expression.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.SchemaAwareFeature
member.summary: The Schema Aware Feature permits the query Prolog to contain a schema import, permits a query to contain a validate expression (see 3.18 Validate Expressions), and permits an XDM to contain types other than xs:untyped and xs:untypedAtomic.]

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.FullAxisFeature
member.summary: The Full Axis Feature permits a query to contain the following axes which are designated as optional axes: ancestor, ancestor-or-self, following, following-sibling, preceding, and preceding-sibling.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.SerializationFeature
member.summary: The Serialization Feature provides means for serializing the result of a transformation.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.HigherOrderFunctionFeature
member.summary: The Higher Order Function Feature allows an expression to evaluate to a function, and allows dynamic function calls.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.LoadXQueryModuleFunction
member.summary: Enables use of the XPath and XQuery Functions and Operators 3.1 fn:load-xquery-module function.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.TransformFunction
member.summary: Enables use of the XPath and XQuery Functions and Operators 3.1 fn:transform function.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.StreamingFeature
member.summary: A processor that claims conformance with the streaming feature must use streamed processing in cases where (a) streaming is requested (for example by using the attribute streamable="yes" on xsl:mode, or the xsl:stream instruction) and (b) the constructs in question are guaranteed-streamable according to the XSLT specification.
member.remarks: This flag is currently ignored. The streaming feature is not currently implemented.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.DynamicEvaluationFeature
member.summary: A processor that claims conformance with the dynamic evaluation feature must evaluate the xsl:evaluate function as described in the XSL specification.
member.remarks: This flag is currently ignored. The dynamic evaluation feature is not currently implemented.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.XPath31Feature
member.summary: A processor that claims conformance with the XPath 3.1 feature must implement XPath 3.1 (including XPath 3.1, XDM 3.1, XSLT and XQuery Serialization 3.1, and Functions and Operators 3.1.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XsltOptionalFeatures.AllFeatures
member.summary: All optional features are enabled.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XsltSettings.ModuleResolver
member.summary: Sets the used during processing of xsl:include and xsl:import declarations.

remarks.para: This resolver is used to resolve URI reference identifying styleheet modules specified in xsl:include and xsl:import declarations.
If this is set to then no external stylesheets can be imported or included.
By default this property is set to .

member.value: An instance to be used during module import.

member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of location hints that are used in xsl:import-schema declarations.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.XsltSettings.XsltVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the XSLT specification to which the processor should adhere.
member.value: A value indicating which version of the specification should be used.
member.exception: Raised if the specified version is not supported.

remarks.para: The default value of this property is the latest version of XSLT which is fully supported. Currently this is .
When set to , if the processor encounters an XSLT module with a version declaration of "3.0", the processor will operate with forwards-compatible behaviour.

When set to , if the processor encounters an XSLT module with a version declaration of "1.0", the processor will operate with backwards-compatible behaviour. The default in-scope functions will be those specified in XPath and XQuery Functions and Operators 3.0.
Settings this value determines the set of available functions for use within XPath expressions and determines the version of XSLT to use when parsing.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.YearMonthDuration
member.summary: Represents a duration of time that is expressed by the Gregorian year and month components. The corresponding XML Schema type is xs:yearMonthDuration.

remarks.para: A is a duration of time that is expressed by the Gregorian year and month. It can be used to represent a period of months, regardless of the number of days in a month. To say, for example, that a season lasts three months.
Unlike values, values can be totally ordered.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Functions and Operators] 10.3.1 xs:yearMonthDuration

member.name: T:XmlPrime.XdmDocument
member.summary: Provides a fast, read-only, in-memory representation of an XML document using the XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Data Model (XDM).

remarks.para: The is the preferred document type for documents used in an XQuery program, an XPath expression, or an XSL transformation.
The differs from in the following respects:

item.description: When the source is a validating reader, XML Schema type information is exposed through the property.
For elements with complex-only content (as defined by XML Schema), any white space text node children will be discarded.

remarks.para: The current implementation is currently unable to read external DTDs, which is required to determine which attributes are marked as ID or IDREFS. This is because the class does not expose the types of attributes declared in a DTD. This has the effect that the fn:id and fn:idref functions may not work correctly.
Markup declarations specified directly in the internal subset are processed to determine the types of attributes.

member.summary: Provides a typed class that represents a compiled XPath 2.0 expression.

member.name: M:XmlPrime.XPath.Compile(System.String)
member.overloads: Compiles the specified XPath expression and returns an object that represents the expression.
member.summary: Compiles an XPath expression and returns a object that represents the expression using a new and the default settings.
member.param: An XPath expression.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.EmptyOrder
member.summary: Specifies the ordering of empty-sequence values.

remarks.para: The empty order policy controls the processing of empty sequences and NaN values as ordering keys in an order by clause in a FLWOR expression.
Use the property to set the default order for empty sequences.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 3.8.3 Order By and Return Clauses
[XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.8 Empty Order Declaration

member.name: F:XmlPrime.EmptyOrder.Least
member.summary: The empty sequence is considered less than any single value, and NaN is considered less than any other value.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.EmptyOrder.Greatest
member.summary: The empty sequence is considered greater than any single value, and NaN is considered greater than any other value.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.Serialization.XmlQualifiedNameCollection
member.summary: Represents a set of XML qualified names.

remarks.para: The is used in the to specify the set of elements whose child text nodes should be serialized as CDATA sections. This occurs during the character expansion phase of serialization.
It is also used in the to specify the set of elements within which indentation should be suppressed.

member.seealso: [XSLT 2.0 and XQuery 1.0 Serialization] 4 Phases of Serialization
