member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.ByteOrderMark
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the output should be preceded by a byte order mark.
member.value: if the output should be preceded by a byte order mark; otherwise .

remarks.para: The property corresponds to the byte-order-mark serialization parameter, which indicates whether the serialized sequence of octets is to be preceded by a Byte Order Mark. If the encoding defines no Byte Order Mark, or if the Byte Order Mark is prohibited for the specific Unicode encoding or implementation environment, then this parameter is ignored. By default this parameter is set to no.
This property is ignored when is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.CDataSectionElements
member.summary: Gets a collection of element names whose contents must be output as CDATA sections.
member.value: The collection of element names which must be output as CDATA sections.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the cdata-section-elements serialization parameter, which contains a list of expanded QNames. If the expanded QName of the parent element of a text node is a member of the list, then the text node is output as a CDATA section.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.CharacterMapping
member.summary: Gets the mapping of characters to string values.
member.value: A mapping of characters to string values.

remarks.para: Character maps allow specific characters that are serialized to be replaced with a specific string of characters. No escaping is applied to the string that is substituted and so this mechanism can be used to introduce arbitrary markup in the serialized output.
This property is ignored when is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.CharacterReferenceStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the way in which character references should be serialized.
member.value: A member of the enumeration indicating how character references should be serialized.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to the character-reference-style serialization property in the http://www.xmlprime.com/serialization namespace.
If is set to or then this property is ignored.
By default this property is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.CheckNamespaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the checking that is performed for namespace URI values.
member.value: One of the values.

remarks.para: When this property is set to serialization will raise a SERE0003 if the namespace URI of a namespace declaration is not a valid absolute URI.
If is set to then setting to causes canonicalization to allow namespace nodes whose namespace URIs are not valid absolute URIs.
This is equivalent to the check-namespaces serialization property in the http://www.xmlprime.com/serialization namespace.
If this property is set to then this is equivalent to if is set to ; or otherwise.
If is set to then this parameter is ignored.
By default this property is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.CloseOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the should also close the underlying or when the method is called.
member.value: to also close the underlying or otherwise . The default is .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.ConformanceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of conformance that the serialized document must conform with.

remarks.para: When this property is set to then serialization will raise a SERE0003 if a document contains top level text nodes, or does not contain a single root element, even if the other serialization settings allow for this.
If is set to then setting the to causes all nodes to be serialized as if they were children of a single top level element.
This is equivalent to the conformance-level serialization property in the http://www.xmlprime.com/serialization namespace.
If this property is set to then this is equivalent to if the output method is set to canonical in the http://www.xmlprime.com/serialization namespace; or otherwise.
By default this property is set to .

member.value: One of the enumerated values.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.DoctypePublic
member.summary: Gets or sets the PUBLIC document type.
member.value: The PUBLIC document type.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the doctype-public serialization parameter. If the doctype-system parameter is specified, then this specifies the public document type to be serialized in the document type declaration. The doctype-public parameter is ignored unless the doctype-system parameter is specified.
The value of this property must either be or a string of PubidChar characters.
This property is ignored when is set to or .
If is set to of and this property is not set to a valid public identifier then a SERE0003 is thrown if serialization is attempted.
By default the property is set to .

member.exception: An SEPM0016 error is raised if an attempt is made to set doctype-public to a string that is not made up of PubidChar characters

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.DoctypeSystem
member.summary: Gets or sets the SYSTEM document type.
member.value: The SYSTEM document type.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the doctype-system serialization parameter. If the doctype-system parameter is specified, then a document type declaration is output immediately before the first element. The doctype-system parameter specifies the SYSTEM document type.
This property cannot contain both a quote character (") and an apostrophe character (').
This property is ignored when is set to or .
By default the property is set to .
If this property is set to a non- value, is set to , is set to or and is not set to or "1.0" then a SEPM0009 is thrown if serialization is attempted.

member.exception: An SEPM0016 error is raised if an attempt is made to set doctype-system to a string that contains both quote (") and apostrophe (') characters.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the character encoding to be used.
member.value: The character encoding to be used.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the encoding serialization parameter, which specifies the encoding to be used for outputting the instance of the data model.

The following encodings are supported (these values are case-insensitive):
IBM037
IBM500
IBM273
IBM277
IBM280
IBM284
IBM285
IBM297
IBM871
IBM1047
iso-8859-1
iso-8859-2
iso-8859-3
iso-8859-4
iso-8859-5
iso-8859-6
iso-8859-7
iso-8859-8
iso-8859-9
iso-8859-13
iso-8859-15
us-ascii
utf-8
utf-16
utf-16BE
utf-16LE
utf-32
utf-32BE
utf-32LE
GB18030
GB18030
unicodeFFFE
Windows-1252
If this property is set to an unsupported value and is not set to then a SESU0007 is raised if serialization is attempted.
This property is ignored when is set to . When serializing to a the encoding specified by the text writer overrides this property.

member.exception: An SEPM0016 error may be raised if an invalid encoding setting is attempted.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.EscapeUriAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether URI escaping is enabled.
member.value: if URI escaping is enabled; otherwise .

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the escape-uri-attributes serialization parameter.

In HTML and XHTML output methods if this property is set to , then all attributes that must take URIs (for example the href attribute on the a tag) will have their values escaped as is performed by the fn:escape-html-uri function.
This property is ignored when is not set to or .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.HtmlVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML version to be used.
member.value: The HTML version to be used.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the html-version serialization parameter.
This parameter specifies the version of HTML to be used in serialization. This property is ignored if is not set to or .
If the version is not supported (HTML version is not 4.0, 4.01 or 5.0 then an SESU0013 error is raised if serialization is attempted.
If this property is set to then the HTML version is assumed to be 4.01. By default this property is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.IncludeContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a meta tag should be added to indicate content type.
member.value: if a meta tag should be added; otherwise .

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the include-content-type serialization parameter.

If this property is set to , then in html and xhtml output methods a meta element is added as the first child of the head element specifying the content type from the media-type property, and with the encoding actually used.
This property is ignored when is not set to or .
By default this property is set to

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether output should be indented.
member.value: if the output should be indented; otherwise .

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the indent serialization parameter.
If this property has the value , then extra whitespace may be added to the serialized document in order to make it easier to read, in accordance with the rules specific to the current output method.
This property is ignored when is set to or .
By default this property is set to

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.AllowDuplicateNames
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a map item serialized as a JSON object using the JSON output method is allowed to contain duplicate member names.
member.value: if the duplicates are allowed; otherwise .

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the allow-duplicate-names serialization parameter.

If this property has the value , then a map item serialized as a JSON object using the JSON output method is allowed to contain duplicate member names. If the value no is specified, serialization error [err:SERE0022] will be raised.
This property is ignored when is set to any value other than .
By default this property is set to

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.IndentationCharacters
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string used for indentation.
member.value: The string of characters used for indentation.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to the indentation-characters parameter in the http://www.xmlprime.com/serialization namespace.
By default the indentation string is two spaces.
This property is ignored if is set to , or is set to or .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.ItemSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets a value the item separator string.
member.value: A string of Unicode characters, or for the default behaviour.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the item-separator serialization parameter.
By default this property is , indicating that the property is absent, and that items will be separated by a single space, or a single newline character in the case of the Adaptive output method.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets a string specifying the media type (MIME content type) of the output.
member.value: The media type of the output.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the media-type serialization parameter.
The value of this property is used in the generated content-type declaration if the is set to and is or . It may also be used to annotate the serialized data, for example in an HTTP request.
The charset parameter of the media type must not be specified explicitly in the value of the of , instead it should be set via the property.
If the value of this property is then the default media type as defined by for the current output method is used.
The default value of this property is .

member.exception: An SEPM0016 error is raised if an invalid media-type setting is attempted.
member.seealso: [RFC 2046] Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part Two: Media Types

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the output method.
member.value: The output method.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the method serialization parameter.
The properties , , , , , and can be used to specify supported output methods.
If this property is set to an unsupported value then a SEPM0016 is thrown if serialization is attempted.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.JsonNodeOutputMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON node output method.
member.value: The JSON node output method.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the json-node-output-method serialization parameter.
The properties , , , and can be used to specify supported output methods.
If this property is set to an unsupported value then a SEPM0016 is thrown if serialization is attempted. The default value is .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.NewLineChars
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string to use for line breaks.
member.value: The character string to use for line breaks.

remarks.para:
All line break (
 characters) and new lines introduced by indentation are replaced with the string specified by this property.
This is equivalent to the new-line-chars parameter in the http://www.xmlprime.com/serialization namespace.
This property defaults to .
This property is ignored if is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.NormalizationForm
member.summary: Gets or sets the normalization form.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the normalization-form serialization parameter.

Specifies the unicode normalization form. All text content in the serialized document will be normalized with this normalization form. This can be set to one of the following (case-insensitive) values:
If this property is not set to a supported value and then a SEPM0016 is thrown.
By default the normalization-form parameter is set to none, and no normalization is performed.
This property is ignored when is set to .

member.exception: An attempt is made to set this property to

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.OmitXmlDeclaration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the XML declaration should be omitted in the output.
member.value: if the XML declaration should be omitted from the output; otherwise .

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the omit-xml-declaration serialization parameter.
If is not set to or then this property is ignored.
By default this property is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.Standalone
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the XML declaration must contain a standalone document declaration.
member.value: if the XML declaration must contain a standalone document declaration; otherwise .

summary.para: This property corresponds to the standalone serialization parameter.

If this property has the value or the value , the XML declaration includes a standalone document declaration with the value specified by this property. If the standalone parameter has the value , the XML declaration will not include a standalone document declaration.
If is not set to or then this property is ignored.
If this property is not set to , is set to and is set to or then a SEPM0009 is thrown when serialization is attempted.
By default this property is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.SuppressIndentation
member.summary: Gets a collection of element names for which indentation must be suppressed.
member.value: The collection of element names for which indentation must be suppressed.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the suppress-indentation serialization parameter, which contains a list of expanded QNames. If the indent parameter has the value yes, (that is has value ) and the expanded QName of an element is a member of the list, then whitespace characters will not be added, elided or replaced in its content

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.UndeclarePrefixes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether serializer should undeclare namespaces.
member.value: if the serializer should undeclare namespaces; otherwise .

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the undeclare-prefixes serialization parameter.
If is set to , then if an element is serialized whose parent has namespaces in scope that are not in scope in the element itself, then these namespaces are undeclared.
If is set to or and the version is set to 1.0 then an SEPM0010 is thrown when serialization is attempted. If is not set to or then this property is ignored.
By default this is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.Serialization.XdmWriterSettings.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the XML version to be used.
member.value: The XML version to be used.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the version serialization parameter.

This parameter specifies either the version of XML (if is set to or ), the HTML version (if is set to ) or the version of the canonical XML specification (if is set to . This property is ignored if is not set to any of the above values.
If the version is not supported (XML version is not 1.0 or 1.1, HTML version is not 4.0 or 4.01 or the Canonical XML version is not 1.0 then an SESU0013 error is raised if serialization is attempted.
If this property is set to then the version is assumed to be 4.01 if is set to , and 1.0 otherwise. By default this property is set to .

member.name: T:XmlPrime.BoundarySpace
member.summary: Specifies the boundary-space policy of an XQuery module.

remarks.para: The boundary space policy controls the processing of boundary whitespace by direct element constructors. Its value may be "preserve" or "strip".
Use the property to set the default boundary space policy.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 3.7.1.4 Boundary Whitespace
[XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 4.3 Boundary-space Declaration

member.name: F:XmlPrime.BoundarySpace.Strip

member.name: F:XmlPrime.BoundarySpace.Preserve
member.summary: Boundary whitespace should be preserved.

member.name: T:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings
member.summary: Represents the user-controllable dynamic context settings of an XPath expression, an XQuery program or an XSL transformation.

remarks.para: For security reasons, the loading of external resources is disabled. This means that the fn:doc, fn:document, fn:collection and fn:unparsed-text functions will always raise an error, and fn:doc-available and fn:unparsed-text-available will always return false().
To enable the loading of external resources, set the property.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context
[XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 2.0] 5.4 The Static and Dynamic Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.AvailableEnvironmentVariables
member.summary: Gets or sets the available environment variables.
member.value: An instance containing a mapping from environment variable names to string values.
member.exception: Raised if the property is set to .

remarks.para: The default value is an empty instances.
The available environment variables can be accessed via the fn:available-environment-variables and fn:environment-variable functions.

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.BaseOutputURI
member.summary: Gets or sets the base output URI.
member.value: The base output URI.
member.exception: The value was set to a relative URI other than , or was an opaque absolute URI.

remarks.para: This is the base URI used to resolve relative URIs given in result-document instructions.
By default this property is set to .

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.ContextItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial context item.
member.value: An representing the initial context item, or if no context item has been set.
member.exception: The value was not an or .

remarks.para: The default value is .
If this property is set to a the value is first cloned.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context
[XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 2.0] 5.4 The Static and Dynamic Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.ContextPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the context position.
member.value: A positive representing the context position, or 0 if the context item is undefined.
member.exception: The value was not a positive less than or equal to .

remarks.para: The context position is the position of the context item within the sequence of items currently being processed. When the context item is defined, the value of the context position is an integer greater than zero. The context position is returned by the expression fn:position(). W.
The default value is 1 when the context item is defined, otherwise 0.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context
[XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 2.0] 5.4 The Static and Dynamic Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.ContextSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the context size.
member.value: A positive representing the context size, or 0 if the initial context item is undefined ().
member.exception: The value was not a positive greater than or equal to .

remarks.para: The context size is the number of items in the sequence of items currently being processed. The context size is returned by the expression fn:last(). When the initial context item is defined, the value of the context size must be an integer greater than zero.
The default value is 1 when the context item is defined, otherwise 0.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context
[XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 2.0] 5.4 The Static and Dynamic Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.CurrentDateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the current date and time.
member.value: A nullable value representing the current date and time. If this value is then the current date and time will be the time when evaluation was started.

remarks.para: The current date and time is the date and time that will be returned by the fn:current-date, fn:current-time and fn:current-dateTime functions. It is however first adjusted to the implicit time zone.
By default is set to and the current date and time will be set to the time when evaluation is started.

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context
[XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 2.0] 5.4 The Static and Dynamic Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.DefaultCalendar
member.summary: Gets or sets the default calendar.
member.value: The default calendar to be used when formatting dates.

remarks.para: This is the calendar used when formatting dates in human-readable output (for example, by the functions fn:format-date and fn:format-dateTime) if no other calendar is requested.
The default value is determined by the value of the property of the .

member.exception: Raised if the property is set to .
member.seealso: [XQuery 3.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.DefaultCollectionURI
member.summary: Gets or sets the default collection URI.
member.value: The default collection URI.

remarks.para: If this property is not set to then any calls to fn:collection with no arguments or with an empty argument will be treated as if they had an argument with this URI instead. This effectively allows the default collection to be set to any other collection in the document set.
If this property is set to then the default collection returned is that resolved by .
By default this property is set to .

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context
[XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 2.0] 5.4 The Static and Dynamic Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.DefaultLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the default language.
member.value: The default language to be used when formatting numbers, dates and times.

remarks.para: This is the natural language used when creating human-readable output (for example, by the functions fn:format-date and fn:format-integer) if no other language is requested. The value is a language code as defined by the type xs:language.]
The default value is determined by the value of the property of the .

member.exception: Raised if the property is set to .
Raised if the property specifies a culture that is not supported.
member.seealso: [XQuery 3.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.DefaultPlace
member.summary: Gets or sets the default place.
member.value: The default place to be used when formatting dates.

remarks.para: This is a geographical location used to identify the place where events happened (or will happen) when formatting dates and times using functions such as fn:format-date and fn:format-dateTime, if no other place is specified. It is used when translating timezone offsets to civil timezone names, and when using calendars where the translation from ISO dates/times to a local representation is dependent on geographical location.
The default value is determined by the value of the property of the .

member.exception: Raised if the property is set to .
member.seealso: [XQuery 3.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.DocumentSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache of documents and collections.
member.value: The instance containing the cache of documents and collections.

remarks.para: The document set keeps a thread-safe cache of all documents and collections available to the query, and those marked as unavailable.

The fn:doc, fn:doc-available, fn:collection, fn:document, fn:unparsed-text and fn:unparsed-text-available functions all retrieve documents and collections through the document set. This enforces stability of these function and the constraint that doc(document-uri($N)) is $N is true for any document node $N.
In order to prevent documents from being loaded every time the XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation is run, the document set can be shared between queries.
The document set can be pre-populated with documents and collections.
If this property is set to then the loading of external resources by functions such as fn:doc and fn:collection is prohibited.
By default, this property is set to

member.name: P:XmlPrime.DynamicContextSettings.ImplicitTimeZone
member.summary: Gets or sets the time zone to be used when a xs:date, xs:time, or xs:dateTime value that does not have a time zone is used in a comparison or arithmetic operation.
member.value: The time zone to be used when a xs:date, xs:time, or xs:dateTime value that does not have a time zone is used in a comparison or arithmetic operation.
member.remarks: The default value is the time zone of the current computer system given by .
member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 2.1.2 Dynamic Context
[XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 2.0] 5.4 The Static and Dynamic Context

member.value: A instance containing the parameters for the XQuery program, XPath expression or XSL transformation. This value can never be .

member.name: T:XmlPrime.OrderingMode
member.summary: Specifies the ordering mode of an XQuery module.

remarks.para: The ordering mode affects the ordering of the result sequences returned by certain path expressions, FLWOR, union, intersect and except expressions.
Currently, the ordering mode is ignored by XmlPrime, and all affected expressions are evaluated with their results in document order.
Use the property to set the default ordering mode.

summary.para: Specifies optional XQuery features which may be switched off.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

remarks.para: Use the property to enable or disable optional XQuery features. Disabling a feature causes an error to be raised during compilation of a query if the feature is used in that query.
Note that the Static Typing Feature may be enabled by setting the or properties to or .

member.seealso: [XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language] 5.2 Optional Features

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.None
member.summary: Minimal conformance. No optional features are enabled.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.TypedDataFeature
member.summary: The Typed Data Feature permits a data model instance to contain element nodes types other than xs:untyped and attributes node types other than xs:untypedAtomic.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.SchemaImportFeature
member.summary: The Schema Import Feature permits the query Prolog to contain a schema import.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.SchemaValidationFeature
member.summary: The Schema Validation Feature permits a query to contain a validate expression.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.SchemaAwareFeature
member.summary: The Schema Aware Feature permits the query Prolog to contain a schema import, permits a query to contain a validate expression (see 3.18 Validate Expressions), and permits an XDM to contain types other than xs:untyped and xs:untypedAtomic.]

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.FullAxisFeature
member.summary: The Full Axis Feature permits a query to contain the following axes which are designated as optional axes: ancestor, ancestor-or-self, following, following-sibling, preceding, and preceding-sibling.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.ModuleFeature
member.summary: The Module Feature allows a query Prolog to contain a module import and allows library modules to be created.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.SerializationFeature
member.summary: The Serialization Feature provides means for serializing the result of a query.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.HigherOrderFunctionFeature
member.summary: The Higher Order Function Feature allows an expression to evaluate to a function, and allows dynamic function calls.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.XQuery10OptionalFeatures
member.summary: All XQuery 1.0 optional features are enabled.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.XQuery30OptionalFeatures
member.summary: All XQuery 3,0 optional features are enabled.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.UpdateFeature
member.summary: The Update Feature permits a query to support the XQuery Update Facility.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.LoadXQueryModuleFunction
member.summary: Enables use of the XPath and XQuery Functions and Operators 3.1 fn:load-xquery-module function.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.TransformFunction
member.summary: Enables use of the XPath and XQuery Functions and Operators 3.1 fn:transform function.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.XQuery31OptionalFeatures
member.summary: All XQuery 3,1 optional features are enabled.

member.name: F:XmlPrime.XQueryOptionalFeatures.AllFeatures
member.summary: All optional features are enabled.
